title: Senior Tech Lead
description:
**Senior Tech Lead – Laravel Backendutvecklare**

**Revolutionera Företagshälsan**


På Qurant Företagshälsa brinner vi för att skapa smarta och effektiva lösningar som främjar hälsosammare och mer produktiva arbetsplatser. Vi söker en erfaren och driven Senior Tech Lead som kan lyfta vår tekniska plattform till nästa nivå. Våra värderingar – **Nytänkande, Proaktivitet, Enkelhet och Samarbete** – är grunden för allt vi gör. Den här rollen är avgörande för att förverkliga dessa värderingar.

**Din Roll:**


Som vår Senior Tech Lead kommer du att:

* Leta utvecklingsteamet och fastställa tekniska riktlinjer och standarder.
* Ansvara för arkitekturen och kodbasen i vår backend, byggd på Laravel.
* Utveckla och optimera tjänster för skalbarhet, prestanda och säkerhet.
* Använda Redis för caching och systemoptimering.
* Samarbeta nära med produktägare och andra team för att omvandla affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar.
* Mentora andra utvecklare och främja deras professionella utveckling. Detta är ett tillfälle att dela med dig av din expertis och bidra till vår samarbetsinriktade kultur.

**Om Dig:**


Vi söker dig som har:

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling med djup kunskap i Laravel och PHP.
* Solid erfarenhet av att arbeta med relationsdatabaser (MySQL är önskvärt).
* Bevisad förmåga att designa och implementera RESTful API:er.
* Erfarenhet av moderna verktyg och metoder inom versionshantering, testning och CI/CD.
* Djup förståelse för prestandaoptimering, särskilt gällande databasfrågor och Redis-caching.
* Erfarenhet av att leda team eller driva tekniska projekt.
* Ett analytiskt tänkande och noggrannhet.

**Meriterande:**


Erfarenhet inom något av följande är meriterande:

* DevOps, särskilt med DigitalOcean eller andra molnplattformar.
* Säkerhetsprinciper och dataskydd (GDPR).
* Frontendutveckling.

**Varför Qurant?**


Bli en del av en dynamisk och snabbväxande miljö där innovation står i centrum. Vi erbjuder:

* Möjligheten att påverka framtiden för företagshälsan.
* En flexibel arbetsplats med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
* Ett sammansvetsat team som värdesätter samarbete och välbefinnande.

**Ansök Nu via länken!!**

title: DEVOPS ENGINEER
description:
**DevOps Engineer - Stockholm**

*As of September 2024, TeamEngine has joined forces with Board Intelligence, the London-based AI board software and advisory firm, to bring Boards all around the world the benefit of their combined products and geographic reach. Hence, whilst this role will work for TeamEngine you will be working with the wider Board Intelligence team.*

**The Opportunity**


Are you interested in making a difference? To work for a tech-for-good company whose reason for being is to help all boards and leadership teams to be a powerful driver of performance and a force for good? Board Intelligence is on a mission to bring kindness and success together and to drive companies to think about what matters. We work with over 30,000 Chairs, CEOs, and board members to embed the discipline of focus into their organisations, and we’re helping a new board every day to focus on what matters. We are in it for the long term, come join us on this journey.


As a DevOps Engineer at Board Intelligence in Stockholm, you’ll bring energy, proactivity, and a passion for staying ahead of AI-driven developments in the DevOps space. With expertise in Google Cloud and AWS, coupled with strong Terraform skills, you’ll play a pivotal role in building and automating scalable cloud infrastructure across multiple sites and providers worldwide. As the company experiences rapid expansion—through acquisitions and the integration of new tech stacks—you’ll be at the forefront of ensuring seamless scalability and innovation, enabling us to push into new countries and maintain our trajectory of exciting growth.


**Key responsibilities of the role**


* Support the design and implementation of multi-cloud infrastructure across Google Cloud and AWS, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Assist with the migration of on-premise systems to the cloud, automating workflows and maintaining hybrid setups as needed.
* Manage Kubernetes clusters using provider-managed services, optimizing containerized workloads for efficiency.
* Contribute to critical upgrades, patching, and cleanouts to mitigate risk and modernize legacy infrastructure.
* Collaborate with engineering and product teams to align infrastructure with business goals, driving innovation and seamless integration.
* Help establish best practices for CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, and system monitoring.

**Requirements**


**What skills and experience you might have**


We prefer to work with the best talent regardless of whether you are familiar with all of the tools that we use. We don’t need you to be familiar with everything on this list but experience in some or all of these areas will be useful and a willingness to dive in and learn the others, essential.


* Experience building and managing cloud environments, ideally across Google Cloud and AWS.
* Familiarity with Terraform and an understanding of infrastructure as code
* Knowledge of Kubernetes and containerized workloads
* Hands-on experience with automation and optimizing infrastructure for scalability and performance
* Understanding of modern DevOps practices, including CI/CD and system monitoring
* A collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams

**Application**

  

Please note that interviews will be held ongoing so do not hold off sending in your application.


Does this sound like something for you? Join our team!

title: Tech Talent Engineer Program within Automotive 2025
description:
**In collaboration with Nexer Tech Talent, we are thrilled to introduce our Tech Talent Engineer Program, starting in February 2025. Launching your career through a talent program provides an unparalleled transition from academia to professional life.** **With Nexer Tech Talent, you're future-proofing your career!**


We are now recruiting for the following positions in the program, starting in February 2025. Their will be 5 exciting positions available in the following areas:

* Software Developer
* Software Developer
  
* 
* More roles will be released continuously.

**The positions are located in Gothenburg.**

**Talent Program: The Bridge between School and Professional Success**


Nexer Tech Talent offers a smooth transition from your studies to a fulfilling career. As a participant, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but have a specific role at Volvo Cars. You'll join a cohort of emerging talents and embark on a customized training journey, blending daily work with skill enrichment to amplify your technical knowledge, your leadership skills, and personal growth.


During your time in the Tech Talent Program you'll be mentored by seasoned professionals at Volvo Cars and receive dedicated guidance from a Consultant Manager at Nexer Tech Talent. With us, you're not just a consultant – you're part of a family. Attend enriching lectures, relaxed after-work events, and engaging lunch meetings. Upon completing the talent program, our goal is to welcome you to a permanent position at Volvo Cars.  



  

**Who Are We Looking For?**

* Early-career professionals with a bachelor/master degree in computer science or relevant field
* As a person you are social and loves to work with problem solving
* Individuals who embody coding and at the same the work close to the customers
* Fluent in English
Possess substantial expertise in C#, .NET, Java, DevOps, JavaScripts etc.  
* 

  

**How to Apply**


The talent program starts in February and is aimed at those who have completed their education. We are continuously working with recruitment, so please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter Johanna Norman at johanna.norman@nexergroup.com  

  

  



**About Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent* *here**.*

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Job ID 2024-11133


Date posted Dec. 20, 2024


Location Lund, Sweden


Category Hardware Engineering


  
Job Overview:


You will be part of a team to design, validate, test and help to build a complex software stack for a high-performance and resilient Arm’s global engineering platform. You will enjoy a challenge, coding and developing complete systems to a high standard.


Working in the Solution Architecture Team, which is part of the Arm Productivity Engineering department, we are responsible for ensuring that we have a confirmed understanding of both our engineering infrastructure and the engineering workflows that run on top of it, by applying a mixture of Software, DevOps, Data Engineering, Data Analytics and Data Visualisation disciplines to a variety of complex engineering problems.


This is an excellent opportunity to learn and expand your skills working with a complex engineering platform!


Responsibilities:

* Design, automate and deploy system integration processes to meet the engineering's needs
* Analyse and find any impacts that technical changes may have on a business processes
* Perform continuous research on new technologies to stay updated with the best alternatives for the existing architectures


Required Skills and Experience :

* Experience implementing infrastructure-as-code (e.g., CloudFormation, Terraform)
* Knowledge of programming languages such as Scala, Java or Python
* Deep understanding of AWS or other cloud providers (e.g. GCP, Azure)
* Understanding of key security technologies and protocols such as TLS, OAuth and SPIFFE.
* Observability, alerting, metrics collection and visualisation (e.g. Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Datadog)


“Nice To Have” :


We would be even more impressed if you are passionate about the following:

* Migrating on-premises services to the cloud
* Container orchestration deployment, configuration, and administration. (e.g. Docker Swarm, Kubernetes)
* Automation and configuration management (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
* Analytics infrastructure and tooling (e.g. Databricks, Apache Spark)


In Return:


We are proud to have a set of behaviours that reflect our culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to defy the ordinary and shape the extraordinary.


#LI-KD1


Accommodations at Arm


At Arm, we want our people to Do Great Things. If you need support or an accommodation to Be Your Brilliant Self during the recruitment process, please email accommodations@arm.com. To note, by sending us the requested information, you consent to its use by Arm to arrange for appropriate accommodations. All accommodation requests will be treated with confidentiality, and information concerning these requests will only be disclosed as necessary to provide the accommodation. Although this is not an exhaustive list, examples of support include breaks between interviews, having documents read aloud or office accessibility. Please email us about anything we can do to accommodate you during the recruitment process.


Hybrid Working at Arm


Arm’s approach to hybrid working is designed to create a working environment that supports both high performance and personal wellbeing. We believe in bringing people together face to face to enable us to work at pace, whilst recognizing the value of flexibility. Within that framework, we empower groups/teams to determine their own hybrid working patterns, depending on the work and the team’s needs. Details of what this means for each role will be shared upon application. In some cases, the flexibility we can offer is limited by local legal, regulatory, tax, or other considerations, and where this is the case, we will collaborate with you to find the best solution. Please talk to us to find out more about what this could look like for you.


Equal Opportunities at Arm


Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
company_addresses: Cambridge, Gloucestershire, South West England, England
company_description: Arm is at the heart of the world’s most advanced digital products, ranging from sensors to servers, smartphones and tablets.

title: Team Manager
description:
**Vill du vara en del av ett företag som växer och sätter innovation i fokus?**


Knightec sitter på 34:e våningen i Nordens högsta kontorshus, Citygate i Göteborg, med en fantastisk utsikt över staden. Hos oss får du möjligheten att leda ett inhouse-team med hög kompetens inom systemutveckling. Tillsammans skapar vi långsiktiga lösningar och produkter med ett produktbolagstänk, i samarbete med några av de mest framstående kunderna inom Medtech, Automotive och Industry.


Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och snabbfotad organisation med korta beslutsvägar och stor frihet där du får utveckla både din egen kompetens och ditt ledarskap.

**Om affärsområdet Dewire**


Dewire är specialister inom Cloud Computing, Data + AI och Software Engineering. Tillsammans med våra kunder driver vi innovation, utvecklar produkter och effektiviserar verksamheter - oftast genom våra DevOps-team som prioriterar samarbete och resultat.

**Om rollen**


Som Team Manager på Knightec kombinerar du ledarskap med operativt arbete i kunduppdrag. Du kommer att:

* **Utveckla och leda teamet:** Coacha och inspirera teammedlemmar i deras kompetens- och karriärutveckling.
* **Bidra till strategiskt ledarskap:** Delta aktivt i Region Wests ledningsgrupp och bidra med din expertis i strategiska beslut.
* **Arbeta operativt:** Ta en aktiv roll i kundprojekt där din tekniska kompetens och ditt ledarskap gör skillnad.
* **Utveckla kundrelationer och driva nykundsbearbetning:** Bygg långsiktiga relationer med befintliga kunder för att stärka deras affärsmöjligheter, samtidigt som du aktivt identifierar och bearbetar nya potentiella kunder inom innovativa teknikområden.


Du har också personalansvar med allt vad det innebär; onboarding av nya medarbetare, utvecklingssamtal, kompetensutvecklingsinsatser och aktiviteter för att stärka sammanhållningen i teamet.

**Vi söker dig som har:**

* **Erfarenhet av ledarskap:** Tidigare roller som Team Lead, Software Architect, Scrum Master eller motsvarande.
* **Teknisk erfarenhet:** Gedigen bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling, gärna med erfarenhet av språk som Java, JavaScript, TypeScript eller C#.
* **Meriterande kunskaper inom Cloud och agila metoder:** Erfarenhet av systemdesign, cloudutveckling och ramverk som Scrum, DevOps eller SAFe är starkt meriterande.
* **Starkt affärssinne:** Vana att arbeta nära affären genom kunddialoger, presentationer och relationsbyggande.
* **Akademisk bakgrund:** En högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område.
* **Språk:** Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


Som person är du engagerad, lyhörd och drivs av att bygga starka relationer, både inom teamet och med kunderna.

  


**Vad vi erbjuder:**  

  

På Knightec får du arbeta i en innovativ och stödjande miljö med projekt som gör skillnad. Vi värderar mångfald och samarbete och tror på att utveckla både produkter och människor. Med över 40 olika nationaliteter och en hybrid arbetsmodell som främjar flexibilitet, erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsplats med balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Här får du möjligheten att växa både personligen och professionellt, med stöd från vårt team och genom spännande projekt för ledande företag.

**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**  

  

Vi på Knightec går nu samman med vårt systerbolag Semcon och bildar **Knightec Group**. Tillsammans blir vi den ledande aktören i norra Europa inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det? Vårt gemensamma erbjudande blir både bredare och djupare, vilket gör att vi kan ta oss an stora, strategiska kundprojekt på högsta nivå av innovation och komplexitet. För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och karriärvägar. Låter detta som platsen för dig? Häng med oss på denna spännande resa!

title: Platform Engineer (Rust)
description:
**Platform Engineer - Rust** 




  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proven expertise in building scalable systems that handle unpredictable and massive loads.
* In-depth experience with Rust, Terraform, and Kubernetes (or comparable tools like Nomad).
* A passion for container isolation and microVM management, leveraging tools like Firecracker.
* Strong focus on security, with the ability to implement and enforce best practices effectively.



  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* Design, maintain, and optimize microVM sandbox infrastructure using Rust, Firecracker, and other advanced tools.
* Develop highly reliable infrastructure that scales seamlessly from minimal to significant demand.
* Optimize microVM performance to achieve extremely fast boot times.
* Implement robust security protocols that inspire confidence in developers and users alike.
* Build self-healing systems capable of addressing and resolving issues proactively.
* Make strategic, long-term infrastructure decisions that ensure sustainability and reliability over time.



  





**Our Tech Stack** 




 We embrace a modern and evolving tech stack to meet the needs of developers and users:
 


* **Frontend** 
 : React for dynamic and responsive interfaces.
* **Backend** 
 : Golang and Rust for optimized performance.
* **Cloud Infrastructure** 
 : Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform.



  





 We are committed to exploring and integrating cutting-edge technologies to stay ahead in the field.

title: DevOps Engineer with Kafka and Event-Driven Architecture Expertise
description:
**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **31st of January** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
To succeed in our journey towards a world without fossil fuels, we are building technical solutions that will help stabilize the energy grid as well help optimize the energy usage of our customers. Now we are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer, who can help us integrate and deploy more efficiently in our AWS platform!
   

  

**The role**
 As our Senior DevOps Engineer, your focus will be to drive learning and develop platform services for developers to adapt. You will set up and administrate our AWS-platform, working with CI/CD, Testing and Automation. In fact, the structure for our cloud infrastructure will be your responsibility!
   

  

 We are a quite small engineering organization today consisting of three teams. Your direct leader will be our Head of Engineering Danny Hajj, feel free to check out his LinkedIn profile here!
   

  

**Are we at match?**
 To thrive at Svea Solar we think it's important that our values correlates with your own since they are the guiding stars that help us move forward. For you to succeed in the role as our Senior DevOps Engineer, we believe you should have multiple years’ experience working with cloud-native CI/CD workflows and tools. Of course, you also should have great knowledge of full software development life cycle and delivery using agile practices.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
 Hands-on experience with microservices and distributed application architecture, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology.
   

  

 If you also have at least 2 of the following, we are sure we would be a good match;
   

  

* Experience in code development in at least one object-oriented programming language.
* Experience with automating cloud-native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure.
* Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code, using AWS CDK, Cloudformation, or other tools
* Experience with self-hosted Grafana observability stack.


 At Svea Solar we believe in Collaboration-first mentality which is why we work three days at the office to share ideas and better collaborate between the teams.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
We are Happy Socks, an innovative fashion company that specializes in designing and producing unique, high-quality fashion items. We sell directly to consumers through our online and physical channels, as well as wholesale to a range of partners. Our tech team is at the core of our digital innovation and development, driving initiatives that enhance the customer experience, optimize internal processes, and improve the efficiency of our supply chain. We value creativity, collaboration, and a forward-thinking approach to problem-solving.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Platform Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that supports our applications and services. You will collaborate closely with developers, product teams, and other stakeholders to create scalable, reliable, and secure systems that power our platform. Your work will ensure our tech stack is efficient, resilient, and optimized for our business needs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and Develop: Build and maintain platform infrastructure to support scalability, reliability, and performance across our applications.
* Automation: Develop tools and scripts to automate deployment, monitoring, and other operational tasks.
* Monitoring and Performance: Set up comprehensive monitoring systems and ensure optimal performance of platform components.
* Collaboration: Work closely with software developers and other engineers to align infrastructure with application requirements.
* Security: Implement and maintain security best practices across infrastructure components, as well as in our development life cycle (SDLC).
* Incident Response: Participate in on-call rotation and assist in troubleshooting and resolving incidents to minimize downtime.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify and drive opportunities to improve platform architecture and processes.
* Disaster Recovery Planning: Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity.
* Business Continuity Planning (BCP): Collaborate with stakeholders to create and update business continuity plans.


**Requirements**
* Knowledge of microservices architecture.
* Strong experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Proficiency in infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Solid understanding of networking, security, and system administration.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
* Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash).
* Problem-solving attitude and ability to work in a collaborative environment.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with Business Central.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana).
* Exposure to distributed systems and event-driven architecture.
* Previous experience working in a fashion or retail tech environment.


 But most importantly, you have the personality to fit a somewhat crazy, fun work environment where we believe in color and playfulness, a place where you can expect the unexpected and you are a source of creative weirdness.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Are you someone who thrives in collaborative environments, where teamwork is key and innovation is encouraged? Do you want to be part of a smaller development team and work close to the business? Here you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our site is up to date and ensuring a seamless user experience. -
 **If this sounds like you, get in touch!**
 So if you're ready to join a diverse and inclusive team where your personality and skills are valued, we want to hear from you! Apply now and let's get you on board ASAP.
   

  

*At Happy Socks, we're all about diversity, so people of all genders, ages, and backgrounds are encouraged to apply.*
**Last note**
 We are happy to receive your application straight away - but we want to make you aware that we will have a slight delay to our processing due to holidays. So please stay tuned! Thanks!
   

  

 Happy Socks aims to spread happiness by turning an everyday essential into a colorful design piece. The business is built on foundations of rigid quality standards, craftsmanship and creativity that are transferred into the products by a talented team of creatives. The products feature endless variations of models and designs, using a broad spectrum of color combinations and original patterns.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior DevOps Engineer** 
 , you will join a team that designs, develops and maintains our speech generating devices. You will focus on the development, implementation, and maintenance of product build, release, manufacturing, and distribution processes. You will support teams in Engineering, Production, Repairs, Product Placement, Technical Support, and Customer Support, ensuring that all areas are aligned and efficient. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Manage and maintain mobile device management systems for the company and its partners, ensuring smooth operations and support.
* Modify and maintain production system software, focusing on testing strategies and tools to ensure optimal performance.
* Oversee hardware utility and support application maintenance, driving continuous improvement.
* Lead the development and maintenance of Windows OEM deployments.
* Administer Apple Developer, Business Manager, App Store Connect, and Enterprise Developer accounts, supporting both internal teams and external partners.
* Provide third-tier product support, offering deep product knowledge and expert troubleshooting to company teams, partners, and customers.
* Collaborate with Project and Application Development teams to maintain high product quality standards.
* Provide critical issue feedback to the QA Manager, ensuring timely resolution and proper issue tracking.
* Assist the QA Manager in enhancing test plans and automated testing processes.
* Work closely with project teams to replicate customer issues and use cases for troubleshooting and resolution.
* Ensure best practices are followed, with clear documentation and high-quality software delivered on schedule.
* Lead projects independently and collaborate effectively with team members to drive results.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field (or equivalent work experience).
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across multiple engineering and support teams.
* Proficiency in C#, Java, PowerShell, Python, and JavaScript.
* Experience with databases such as MSSQL, MySQL, SQLite.
* Knowledge of iOS, Windows, Android, and web application platforms.
* Familiarity with Xcode, Visual Studio, CMake, Azure, AWS, Git, TeamCity, GitHub, and Jira.


**Additional Skills:** 
  

  

* Strong attention to detail and ability to develop automated solutions.
* Solid understanding and hands-on experience with Software QA methodologies, techniques, and tools.
* Good project management skills, with the ability to monitor workloads and ensure efficient task allocation.
* Strong organizational skills and a thorough understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Tech Lead
description:
**Rollen:**
* Säkerställa att initiativet är i linje med organisationens övergripande strategi.
* Arbeta nära tvärfunktionella team, inklusive produktägare, designers och andra ingenjörer, för att säkerställa en sammanhållen leverans.
* Hantera tekniska utmaningar som uppstår under utvecklingsprocessen genom att använda starka analytiska och problemlösande färdigheter för att hitta effektiva lösningar.
* Säkerställa teknisk kvalitet, skalbarhet och hållbarhet i leveranser.
* Kommunicera tydligt med ledning, produktägare och utvecklingsteam.
* Driva workshops och möten för att skapa samsyn och lösa konflikter.
* Identifiera och mitigera risker kopplade till tekniska och organisatoriska utmaningar.
* Proaktivt lösa problem som kan påverka tidplaner och resultat.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av systemutveckling, integrationer och arkitektur.
* Förståelse för både traditionella och agila projektmetoder.
* Erfarenhet av att driva initiativ med många intressenter i en matrisorganisation.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och vana att agera brygga mellan tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.
* Ge vägledning och stöd till teammedlemmar för att främja deras professionella tillväxt och utveckling.


**Ska-krav:**
* Erfarenhet i Azure och / eller annan relevant molnteknik.
* SaaS- tjänster
* PaaS-tjänster, såsom API-hantering, containers, datalagring och meddelandehantering.
* Senior inom utveckling och gärna erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur.
* Trygghet i agila principer/SAFe.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram och utveckla lösningar som spänner över flera team/affärsdomäner
* DevOps/FinOps
* Utveckling i Java, Spring Boot , ServiceBus, PostgreSQL, CosmosDB, MongoDB, Redis.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga REST-APIer och standarden OpenAPI
* Erfarenhet av att driva utveckling i komplexa affärsdomäner med flertal beroenden
* Produktutveckling med höga krav på tillgänglighet och prestanda


**Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.**
**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 02-02-2025-01-02-2026
   

  

**Sista ansökningdag:** 
 02-02-2025
   

  

*Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.*

title: Cloud Architect Azure
description:
Om rollen
   

  

**Vill du arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser?**
 Sopra Steria, Nordens ledande företag inom digital transformation, söker en erfaren och kompetent Cloud Architect inom Azure med dokumenterad erfarenhet för att stärka vårt framstående team. Vi har blivit erkända som Karriärföretag och en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work. I denna roll kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i leveransen av innovativa molnbaserade projekt till våra kunder samt bidra till vidareutvecklingen av vårt framstående molnerbjudande
   

  

**Som Arkitektkonsult Inom Azure Kommer Du Att**
* Delta aktivt i planering, design och implementation av Azure-lösningar för våra kunder.
* Operativt arbeta med lösningar som omfattar hela bredden av Azure-plattformen, inklusive IaaS och PaaS, med fokus på Entra ID för identitets- och åtkomststyrning.
* Coacha och vägleda kunder om optimal användning av moln- och hybridteknologi för att implementera nya lösningar eller migrera befintliga tjänster till Azure.
* Fungera som ämnesexpert som stödjer flera team eller som teknisk teamledare med övergripande ansvar för leveransen.


**För att lyckas med detta tror vi att du:**
* 5 till 8 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Azure-arkitekt med stark tekniskt fokus och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att automatisera och optimera arbetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att översätta kundens behov till konkreta designförslag och implementeringar.
* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen med förmåga att arbeta i både stora och små team.


**Kvalifikationer Och Färdigheter**
* Erfarenhet av design och implementering av lösningar i det publika molnet, med fokus på kostnadsoptimering, säkerhet, skalbarhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Kompetens inom programmerings- och/eller skriptspråk (Powershell, Bash, Python etc.).
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg som Azure DevOps eller GitHub.
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (ARM, Bicep, Terraform etc.).
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av ramverk som Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework, Security Adoption Framework samt Well-Architected Framework
* Kunskap inom molnsäkerhet och Zero Trust arkitektur.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av containerlösningar som Docker och Kubernetes är meriterande.


**Om Sopra Steria**
 Sopra Steria är en global aktör inom digital transformation med över 50 000 medarbetare i över 30 länder, varav 600 i Sverige. Vi har blivit rankade som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work och är ett av topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation enligt Gartner. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och skicklig arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att vässa dina kunskaper och arbeta med branschens mest spännande projekt. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget och skapa verklig förändring genom digital utveckling.
   

  

 Har du fler frågor? Om du har några fler frågor angående tjänsten får du gärna höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare Teodor Nellvik ([email protected]).
   

  

 Sopra Steria tar inte emot CV:n från företag som vi inte har ramavtal tillsammans med. Vi tar inte ansvar för eventuella avgifter på CV:n som skickas oönskat till oss. To all recruitment agencies without a base agreement: Sopra Steria does not accept resumes from agencies with whom we do not have an agreement. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Sopra Steria employees or any other company location. Sopra Steria is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

**Ytterligare Information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

description:
**Data Engineer**

 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. **experience:**

title: Infrastructure Lead
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a critical part of our platform strategy. As a leader of the SRE team, you will focus on guiding your team in providing technical expertise and support to our engineering teams to enable them to deliver high-quality software solutions efficiently.
   

  

 Your team will be responsible for providing continuous support to other departments, overcoming major technical hurdles, improving performance , implementing system monitoring and building highly available software.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Providing support and leadership for our SRE team to solve operational challenges.
* Managing the assignment of tasks for the team according to priorities and capacity.
* Having a positive attitude and the ability to understand the critical urgency of topics and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ensuring non-functional requirements for all applications and tools are met and clearly communicated.
* Providing counsel to our internal software engineering team and proactively suggesting improvements on how to operate our microservice-based solution.
* Provide informal feedback on an ongoing basis and formal feedback in the annual performance evaluation process to identify and develop talent.
* Coaching Payments Product team members in achieving goals and developing necessary skills.
* Organise team trainings and initiatives.
* Identify team goals and evaluate team progress.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Minimum 5 years of software engineering or devops experience.
* Minimum 2 years of experience as a team lead or manager.
* Practical experience in using common cloud APIs.
* Strong knowledge of Linux and shell scripting, as well as higher level protocols and patterns like HTTP/3, REST, JSON and gRPC.
* Expertise in systems integration and distributed large scale microservice deployments.
* Experience in operating and monitoring container workloads and similar technologies.
* Strong code reading and understanding skills with at least one high level programming language


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**

* Occupational Pension.
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually.
* Parental Leave Top-Up.
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner.
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance.
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts.
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

* As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Senior PostgreSQL Database Administrator ,Poland, Onsite
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a** 
 Senior PostgreSQL Database Administrator
 **🚀**
**Location:** 
 Warsaw, Poland, Onsite
   

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Senior PostgreSQL Database Administrator**
***About VIPAS :***
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

***Job Description:***
 We are looking for an experienced
 **Senior PostgreSQL Database Administrator** 
 to join our team for a high-impact assignment in the banking industry, supporting
 **Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP)** 
 . This role involves managing and optimizing PostgreSQL databases, ensuring high availability, security, and operational efficiency in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
   

  

***Key Responsibilities:***
**Database Management** 
 : Install, configure, and maintain PostgreSQL on Linux/Windows; handle upgrades and migrations.
   

  

**Performance Tuning** 
 : Monitor and resolve bottlenecks; optimize queries and schema design.
   

  

**Backup & Recovery** 
 : Manage strategies, ensure RPO/RTO compliance.
   

  

**Security Management** 
 : Implement and audit security, conduct vulnerability assessments.
   

  

**Automation** 
 : Create scripts for automation using Bash, Python, or equivalent; integrate CI/CD.
   

  

**Operational Support** 
 : Proactive monitoring, troubleshooting, and documenting best practices.
   

  

**Collaboration** 
 : Support development, DevOps, and infrastructure teams.
   

  

***Requirements:***
  

  

- Experience:

* 7+ years of experience as a PostgreSQL DBA in production environments.
* Proven expertise in managing large-scale PostgreSQL environments with replication, clustering, and partitioning.


- Technical Skills:

* In-depth understanding of PostgreSQL architecture, extensions, and tools.
* Expertise in SQL query optimization and debugging.
* Strong knowledge of Linux systems, shell scripting, and troubleshooting.
* Familiarity with tools like Grafana and pgAdmin.


- Language Proficiency:

* Fluent in English (proficient level).


- Certifications (Preferred):

* PostgreSQL CE or equivalent certifications.


- Soft Skills:

* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Advanced understanding of database performance tuning, security best practices, and operational processes.
* Hands-on experience with automation tools and CI/CD integration for database management.


***What we Offer:***
* B2B agreement
* Transparent working conditions with both Ework and the client
* Private medical care
* Life insurance
* Multisport
* Possibility to work in an international environment
* Swedish organizational culture
* Teambuilding events


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at
 **sandhya@vipas.se**
 Note: Please do apply if you have POLAND PR/ citizenship OR a POLAND work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Senior BI utvecklare till Alecta
company_industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Insurance, and Insurance Agencies and Brokerages
description:
**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vill du vara en del av Alecta och vara med och utveckla den analytiska förmågan som är avgörande för våra affärsbeslut? Är du en passionerad BI-utvecklare som vill arbeta med innovativa lösningar i en spännande och växande organisation? Då har vi en fantastisk möjlighet för dig!
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Hos oss på Alecta får du spela en central roll i utvecklingen och förvaltningen av våra BI-lösningar som är implementerade i Azure Databricks. Detta arbete är av största vikt för Alectas affärsbeslut och förvaltningen av de tillgångar vi hanterar. Du kommer att vara med och forma lösningarna som ligger till grund för analyser och beslut om Alectas produkter och kapitalförvaltning.
 



  





 I din roll kommer du att samarbeta nära affärsverksamheten för att skapa lösningar som möter deras behov och som samtidigt förbättrar vår tekniska plattform. Du kommer att arbeta med SQL, Python och PowerShell för att bearbeta och analysera data, samtidigt som du bidrar till vårt ständiga förbättringsarbete. Vi värdesätter initiativ, kreativitet och din vilja att alltid sträva efter förbättring.
 



  





 Alecta erbjuder en arbetsmiljö som främjar både personlig och professionell utveckling och där du får stor frihet att växa i din roll. Hos oss får du chansen att vara en nyckelperson i ett passionerat och kompetent team. Vi vill att du ska trivas och må bra, och därför erbjuder vi goda möjligheter till balans i livet, inklusive flexibelt distansarbete och friskvårdsförmåner.
 



  





**Din profil** 



* En akademisk bakgrund eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling, dataanalys och gärna inom bank, finans eller försäkring.
* Flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och dataanalys, och som trivs med att arbeta i agila team.
* Teknisk erfarenhet och kunskap inom Azure Databricks, Python, SQL, PowerShell och gärna MS Azure DevOps pipelines, MS Bicep, MS SQL Server och datamodellering.
* En förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med verksamheten för att säkerställa lösningar som möter deras behov och skapar affärsnytta.
* Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  





 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är:
 


* **Passionerad och driven** 
 : Du brinner för teknik och dataanalys och vill utvecklas tillsammans med ditt team.
* **Analytisk och lösningsorienterad** 
 : Du har en hög analytisk förmåga och är van att hitta lösningar på komplexa problem.
* **Strukturerad och noggrann** 
 : Du tycker om att få ihop detaljer till en helhet och har förmågan att leverera högkvalitativa resultat.
* **Samarbetsinriktad och kommunikativ** 
 : Du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra, är lyhörd och delar gärna med dig av din tekniska kompetens.



  





**Om Alecta** 




 Alecta är en av Sveriges största förvaltare av tjänstepensioner, med ett uppdrag att skapa största möjliga värde för våra kunder genom god avkastning och låga kostnader. Vi förvaltar över 1300 miljarder kronor för 2,8 miljoner privatkunder och 35 000 företagskunder. Vi är ett företag i ständig utveckling, och vårt arbete med data och teknik är en central del av vår strategi för framtiden. www.alecta.se
 



  





 Hos oss på Alecta får du en unik möjlighet att arbeta på en arbetsplats med starkt fokus på teknik och innovation, där du får vara med och påverka hur vi hanterar data och utvecklar våra system. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats som präglas av
 **samarbete** 
 ,
 **prestigelöshet** 
 och
 **utveckling** 
 . Dessutom erbjuder Alecta mycket goda förmåner samt ett kontor i centrala Stockholm.
 



  





**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Alecta med Inhouse IT & Tech. Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst på heltid med placering på Alectas kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mejl, utan du söker enkelt tjänsten via hemsidan; www.inhouse.se. Du behöver inte skicka med något personligt brev då vi är övertygade om att ditt CV räcker gott och väl. Om du går vidare i processen kommer du som ett första steg att få svara på ett antal urvalsfrågor. Processen innehåller även arbetspsykologiska tester. Ansök redan idag då urval sker löpande! Därefter kontaktar vi dig för nästa steg. Har du några funderingar så är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@inhouse.se, 0733118726
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: E-commerce specialist and product owner
description:
We are looking for a passionate and innovative eCommerce specialist and product owner (f/d/m) who wants to play an integral role in the development of our online shops.  

  

**The role**  

  

In this role, you will drive the discovery phase of new features and optimize our online shops for maximum efficiency and conversion. You discover and analyze current pain points and develop solutions in collaboration with the business and the technical teams for whom you prioritize and manage the product backlog. You will oversee the operation of our Commerce platform and support internal and external users in leveraging it.



Your solution-driven hands-on mentality will catalyze our mission to continue delivering excellent experiences to our customers.



As part of the central team for commercial business transformation you will be working with cross-functional experts located across Europe focussing on optimizing our customer experience. At the forefront of digital sales, we are contributing to the future of sales in our organization, and you will be a crucial part of this journey.



This role can be fulfilled in a hybrid or remote setup by candidates located in the European Union. A permanent work permit for the EU is mandatory.



Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to


* Creation of user stories, backlog grooming and prioritization, sprint planning
* Level support for Commerce platform
* Test management of user acceptance testing
* User training
* Follow up & monitoring of targets, KPIs and system processes
  


**Who are you?**  

  

Required characteristics


* Excellent English language verbal and written
* Experience working with cross-functional software development teams, applying agile principles to daily work. Ability to adapt and implement agile methodologies effectively.
* Track record of building strong connections with stakeholders at various levels of the company hierarchy. Ability to work closely with stakeholders from different business areas to drive value for customers.
* Excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills
* Tech savvy, passionate about digital innovation


Desirable experience


* Consulting experience
* Experience as SCRUM product owner
* Experience in user support / training
* Experience with SAP Commerce Cloud
  


**Why Duni Group?**  

  

We offer you the opportunity to work in an international company where sustainability is high on the agenda. You get to work together with passionate colleagues and through our commitment, we help each other reach our goals. We believe in your infinite potential and ability to develop. Through your curiosity and courage you will get the opportunity to make a difference.

  

**Further information and application**  

  

We would love to know more about you and your motivation for this job!



To apply, use the application form below. We do not accept applications through email with regards to GDPR. Please send us your CV in English.



If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact hiring manager Jannik Schuh at Jannik.schuh@duni.com.



Please note that we will be working with a continuous selection process, which means that we may close the application process earlier than stated if we find the right candidates. So, don’t delay, please send us your application today.



Start: As soon as possible, with regards of the notice period.

  

**About Duni Group**  

  

Duni Group is a market leader in sustainable dining and food packaging solutions for the restaurant market. The Group markets and sells its products under primarily the brands Duni, BioPak and Paper+Design, which are represented in more than 40 markets. Duni Group has around 2,400 employees in 22 countries, its headquarters in Malmö and production units in Sweden, Germany, Poland, New Zealand and Thailand. Duni Group is listed on NASDAQ Stockholm under the ticker “DUNI”.



If you have not already gotten a good feeling for who we are, go to our website www.dunigroup.com. Here you can read more about who we are and what we are passionate about. Hopefully you want to be part of our team!

  

**Duni Group as a Career Company**  

  

Duni Group has been recognized as one of Sweden’s top 100 employers for the fitfh year in a row. The recognition comes from Karriärföretagen (Career Company), an organization that has been presenting Sweden’s most attractive employers since 2011. Companies go through a selection process by an expert panel and a qualified jury, to be named a Career Company by Karriärföretagen.



Duni Group has been recognized for creating a joyful and passionate workplace, offering our employees opportunities to grow personally and professionally. We've also been acknowledged for our strong focus on innovation and sustainability.

title: ISV Partner Go-to-Market Partner Development Manager, AWS Nordics Partner Organization
description:
· Extensive IT partner management experience and partner network in the Nordics 
· Extensive experience and demonstrated track record of success in technology related sales/channel/business development
· Extensive experience in working within matrix operating structures, to consistently exceed expectations against defined goals and objectives
· Strong understanding of cloud and IT technologies, trends and partner business models, as well as proven track record of building and driving complex multi-year partnerships with a diverse sets of channel partners
· Excellent verbal & written communication and demonstrated senior stakeholder management experience, including ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive goals to completion
  

\*\*This position can be based in any of AWS offices in The Netherlands, Sweden or Denmark\*\*
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
As an ISV Partner Development Manager, you will accelerate joint customer success in region with our Infra (or HBA) Technology Partners, building pipeline and driving MP adoption.
Reporting directly into the Area APO Leader the Area ISV PDME will be responsible for local engagement with CoE-Managed ISV who requires support for in-country events, engagement with AWS country teams, or GTM initiatives to deliver qualified Partner Originated pipeline growth and converted customer contracts.
This area focused role provides a vital point of reference for Technology Partners to bridge the gap between the EMEA PDME development activity and the ISM sales activity. 
You will be responsible for defining the ISV strategy for your assigned territory, building GTM plans for ISV engagement, top-to-top sales alignment, localized sales-plays execution and pipeline generation, support pipeline qualification, local field enablement of ISVs (Better-Together, Co-Sell, AWS Marketplace, MEDDPICC) with ISV Partners and align with local consulting partners to support power of 3 motions.
Key job responsibilities
The Area ISV PDME will focus on engaging with CoE-Managed ISV partners within their category and in the Area to deliver a launched ARR objective, supporting the growth of ISV co-sell wins, and delivering growth in Qualified+ Pipeline measured by ARR value.
You will be responsible for determining and documenting the Tech Partner baseline to identify the areas of strength/weakness and opportunity for your assigned area and category, delivering updates to the monthly 2x2 for the Area and Tech Partner Org, and providing input to the OP planning cycles.
You will co-ordinate your ISV engagements with the Infra (or HBA) PDMEs, ISM teams, and Partner Marketing within your Area, localizing joint GTM motions consisting of multiple partners (i.e. Power of 3 ISV+ISV, ISV+Channel) to engage with customers to generate Partner Originated pipeline. You will work with the partner to ensure that the pipeline progresses to a qualified stage whereby the ISM team will take over responsibility to managed and close the opportunities.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  

* Enterprise solution sales experience
* Experience working with large and complex consulting partners, Telco, Global System Integrators, or distributors
* Master’s Degree
* Experience and familiarity with the AWS platform, products, solutions and capabilities

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Technical Lead AI & ML
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



We are seeking an enthusiastic Technical Lead to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate should have deep technical knowledge in machine learning and artificial intelligence, including a strong understanding of relevant programming languages, tools, and tech-stacks as well as a passion for coaching others. As a Tech Lead AI/ML, you will be responsible for designing and implementing cutting-edge AI/ML solutions to help our clients solve complex business problems.



You will work closely with our architects, development teams, project managers, and customers to ensure that our software solutions meet the highest standards of quality, scalability, and maintainability. You will lead, coordinate and coach other developers, while contributing hands-on technically to projects. You will also actively participate in the quotation process, together with Project office (PMO), sales and system engineers as applicable.



**WHAT YOU WILL DO**



* Develop and implement advanced AI/ML algorithms, models, and systems to solve complex business problems.
* Apply machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to IoT solutions and device edge-AI solutions, including working with embedded systems and sensors.
* Use cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP to deploy and scale AI/ML solutions.
* Assist sales and PMO with presales work with potential customers to understand their needs and recommend solutions.
+ Engage in dialogue with customers and other stakeholders to suggest technical solution(s) for customer’s ideas, vision and/or needs.
+ Answer technical questions from potential customers, direct and/or after investigation.
+ Understand the customer’s needs by asking open questions, being thoughtful, communicative, and creative.
+ Provide insights into technology through verbal pictures and sketched drawings.
+ Participate in the quotation process, together with PMO, sales and system engineers as applicable.
+ Work directly with our customers, document and present the solution and explain the technical decisions taken, including the tradeoffs and consequences of those decisions.
* Contribute to the development of competence, best practices, tools, and frameworks to improve our AI/ML capabilities.
+ Collaborate with developers within and from other sites to ensure that our solutions are scalable and reliable.
+ Coach and guide developers to help them grow their technical skills and expertise.
+ Stay up-to-date with the latest AI/ML trends, tools, and technologies to ensure that our solutions are cutting-edge.

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



To succeed in this role, we expect you to have:



* 10+ years of overall work experience.
* 5+ years of experience in developing ML algorithms and AI-driven solutions.
* Experience and proven track record with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
* Experience and proven track record with AI-driven IoT solutions in either consumer electronics, automotive, manufacturing, heavy equipment, mining or avionics.
* Experience with edge-AI solutions, especially power, processing and memory optimization.
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Quick grasp of concepts and underlying patterns.
* Ability to work in a collaborative, creative and team-oriented environment.
* Ability to lead and positively influence others.

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**


* Experience with ML on platforms such as Qualcomm, Nordics or Silabs.
* Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka to develop data pipelines for machine learning.
* Visualizing and communicating data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders using data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
* Experience developing web or mobile apps.


If you are a curious, adept, diligent, communicative, and collaborative leader with a passion for AI/ML and IoT solutions, we would love to hear from you.


### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Connectivity is a global leader in providing innovative technology solutions for businesses across industries. With over 19 years of experience in the industry, we specialize in developing custom software and hardware solutions, especially connected products within consumer electronics and IoT devices that help our clients optimize their operations and achieve their strategic business goals. Our solutions are scalable, reliable, cost-efficient and secure. We work closely with our clients to understand their vision and ensure that our solutions meet their specific needs and requirements.



At Sigma Connectivity, we believe in the power of technology to transform businesses and drive innovation. We are committed to delivering exceptional results for our clients, and we take pride in our ability to build long-lasting relationships based on trust, transparency, and mutual success.



Our team of 700 brilliant engineers are passionate about technology and are dedicated to designing and building cutting-edge solutions that leverage the latest advancements in technologies across industries. We foster a culture of sharing experiences and knowledge, with a touch of the Nordic work ethic. Our main office is in Lund, Southern Sweden. We ensure global presence with offices in US, UK, Poland, Germany and Denmark. We are a fast-growing company and are constantly looking for open-minded, talented people who want to be part of our journey. Within Sigma, you will never work alone.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**  

We are looking for an enthusiastic junior to mid-level data scientist to join our dynamic and growing team at LeoVegas. The ideal candidate will have an open-minded attitude and be eager to learn. You will get the opportunity to work hands-on in the entire lifecycle of putting machine learning based applications in production.  

Our team is responsible for providing the entire organisation, including all brands and markets, with algorithms for decision-making support, product personalization, and optimization and automation of business processes. Our project portfolio is diverse and constantly growing. Examples include churn prediction, lifetime-value prediction, player risk assessment models (responsible gaming), money laundering detection, and recommender systems to name a few.  

Our data science team is not focused on reporting; we actively develop and deploy models into production that directly serve and enhance the entire organisation. **YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:*** Interpret stakeholder requirements to develop, implement, and fine-tune machine learning models that address their specific needs and business objectives.
* Improve and maintain existing machine learning models to enhance their performance, accuracy, and efficiency over time as well as following new regulations.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams, including product, engineering, and business, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of machine learning solutions with overall company goals.
* Analyse and transform data using SQL to prepare datasets for machine learning model development and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
* Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and promotions.
* Collaborate with external parties to enable outsourced ML based applications.
* Perform advanced analysis on large and complex datasets to extract actionable insights and inform the business to make informed decisions

  

**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**  

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

* Understanding of fundamental concepts in statistics and machine learning
* Experience in apply machine learning, either in academia or industry
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
* Experience with SQL
* Basic understanding of Git

  

NICE TO HAVES

* Experience in any of the following techniques or systems: Airflow, Bayesian statistics, BigQuery, causal inference, Docker, GitHub, Google Cloud Platform, Kubeflow, natural language processing, neural networks, scikit-learn, Stan, survival analysis, TensorFlow, time-series forecasting, Vertex AI, and XGBoost

 **WHO WE ARE**

  

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.  

  



**BENEFITS**  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation *(**T&C apply)*
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

 **JOIN US!**

  

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!


Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*  

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

company: TMP Worldwide India Private Limited_HCL Infra EU
description:
**HCL** 

We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.

HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.

It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.

***Note: Candidates must be eligible to work in Sweden***

***Fluent in Swedish and English***

**Job Description**

We are looking for a Desktop Support Engineer to join our team in Helsingborg site .They will work in a very dynamic environment as a member of a team of several engineers who will accompany you in your growth. They will provide level 2/3 desk-side IT support for different devices (Desktops, Laptops, Tablets and Smartphones).

**Knowledge required for this role-**

· Good understanding of support processes and ability to manage and develop a team

· Experience in managing a team of Field Support engineers, IT Support engineers

· Experience on Vendor service management

· Excellent communication and co-operation skills

· Proactive and independent ways of working

· Fluent oral and written English

· ITIL knowledge, certificate is considered an advantage

· Good interpersonal skills and customer-oriented mindset

· Should be able to understand the IT Infrastructure, IT Change Management, Understanding of Network and Servers

· Should be able to work on Microsoft Office tools

**Main Responsibilities:**

· Provide IT operational expertise leveraging

1) global industry standards (e.g.: ITIL)

2) ensuring Customer’s standards are followed

**Benefits**

These are apart from the statutory benefits applicable in the country.
