title: Customer Data Analyst - Loyalty
description:
We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Clarion Collection® Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 166 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.
We are now looking for a **Customer Data Analytics** expert to join our team at Strawberry! We are seeking someone who can help us enhance the member experience and strengthen both the transactional and emotional loyalty within our club.



Our goal is to ensure that our members always feel valued, and that our loyalty program continuously evolves to meet their needs. To achieve this, we need you – an analyst with a sharp eye for data, insights, and solutions to take our loyalty program to the next level. If you have experience with loyalty programs, and have worked with data and analytics to drive business value, we would love to talk to you!


### **What you will be doing:**



In this role, you will play a key role in identifying how we can improve the member experience, journey, and lifecycle. You will be part of an analytics team responsible for understanding our customers and their behaviors, making our products and services more relevant to them every day. By gathering and analyzing relevant data, conducting modeling, presenting insights, and recommending actions, you will help the organization deliver the best customer experience, drive business KPIs, and strengthen both transactional and emotional loyalty.



You will work closely with other analysts and specialists, and interact daily with business experts from Loyalty, CRM, Product, and even Business Finance.  

  

**Your main responsibilities:**


* Analyze internal and external data to provide answers and drive business actions for our members.
* Create what-if scenarios and run experiments to test hypotheses about member behavior and value.
* Ensure delivery of data and insights to guide the development roadmap for the Loyalty program and partner portfolio.
* Build models to segment customers, predict next actions, and support improved personalization for members.
* Promote data awareness within the business and support the organization’s data-driven decision-making goals.
* Establish best practices to increase the business’s appetite for analytics, improve insights adoption, and promote self-service.
* Be the data-driven thought leader for loyalty analytics.

### **Who we think you are:**



You have strong analytics skills and understanding of how to work with data. As an excellent communicator, you can clearly explain data and insights and thrive in a multilingual environment. You also possess a commercial mindset and can proactively identify business opportunities that support program goals and KPIs. Experience in working with loyalty programs and knowledge of loyalty data is a plus!

  

**Your skills and qualifications:**


* At least 3 years of experience in a Data analyst role.
* Confident in working with large data sets using SQL and extracting data by writing complex queries.
* Database experience, especially Snowflake and BigQuery/Google Cloud.
* Confident working with visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau and Looker Studio.
* Proven experience analyzing data in Python, R or similar.

### **We will offer you:**


* The opportunity to influence the creation of a member journey which impacts end-user value directly
* Exceptional colleagues and an inclusive, experimentation-based, and innovative culture - we love to share and learn from each other, and test ideas if they work
* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work - we are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.

### Sounds interesting?



If you're ready to embark on this exciting journey with us, we'd love to hear from you! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis and the position might be filled before the last application date, don’t wait to submit your application!

title: Dev Ops Engineer
description:
#### **Role overview**


We are looking for a Dev Ops engineer with experience in building and managing high-performing and scalable systems to handle massive amounts of transactions.  

  

Our platform is built on containerised microservices that we deploy in the cloud through continuous deployment. We are working with test driven development to ensure high quality and we can quickly implement new software into production. The future includes moving towards streaming data and "data lakehouse" architecture

#### **Main Responsibilities**


You will be part of a small and high performing team taking care of our Operational environment. You will take full responsibility for the provisioning, development and monitoring of our infrastructure, therefore a solid understanding of modern computing technology is essential and knowledge of cloud environments is beneficial.

#### **Your profile**

* At least 3 years of experience of Dev Ops
* Experience of working with cloud platforms (in particular AWS)
* Solid Kubernetes experience is essential
* You know how to work with high volume data
* You can quickly pick up an understanding of the business you are working with and are able to convert that knowledge into technical solutions that fulfill client needs
* GitOps, IAC, CICD, Helm, Python
* Linux (e.g. Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.)
* Webservers (e.g. Nginx, Apache, Lighttpd, etc.)
* Version Control (Git)
* Shell Scripting (sh, BASH, etc.)
* TCP/IP Networking (IPv4 & IPv6)
* Active knowledge of industry trends
* Excellent written and verbal communication in English

#### **Why us?**


Tradedoubler is an international performance marketing partner, creating smarter results for its clients and partners through traffic, technology and expertise. We help our clients grow their online sales and find new customers for their businesses and we help an expanding network of online publishers monetise their websites.  

  

Working at Tradedoubler is stimulating, challenging and fun. We pride ourselves in offering an environment where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the success of our business. Our employees come from all over the world, producing a culturally diverse environment where creativity, communication and idea sharing are highly valued.  

  

We recognise that our employees are the key to our success and with this in mind we offer competitive salaries and benefits as well as the opportunity for every employee to grow with us.

#### **About us**


Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.  

In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).  

  

Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.  

  

One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: Software Engineering Manager for global tech house in Iasi
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Sigma Connectivity SRL**
  

**Software Engineering Manager for global tech house in Iasi**  



**Company Story**
  

Sigma Connectivity is a global tech house with all the resources needed to bring a product to market under one roof. We believe in investing in knowledge and education, making a positive impact on society and shaping a brighter future for all.
  

Through our core values, at Sigma Connectivity we create an environment that fosters growth, creativity, and collaboration. Our company culture promotes the freedom to explore new ideas and push the boundaries of what is possible.
  

Working with us means you will be working in an international environment with a diverse and inclusive atmosphere. We operate globally from 13 sites and have expert teams in North America, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, United Kingdom, Poland and Romania.



**Introduction (The job & Team)**
  

One year ago, we opened our newest office in Iași, Romania, and we’re looking for a talented leader to continue driving our growth. We are searching for a Software Engineering Manager who is genuinely interested in people, loves technology, and is excited to understand and meet customer needs.



**Your Role:**
  

In this role, you’ll have the chance to be involved in the entire process, from attracting and hiring new talent to setting team and project goals, participating in budget discussions, and shaping our software strategy. You’ll work closely with your team, various stakeholders, and customers, while also collaborating with engineering managers at our headquarters in Lund, Sweden.


**You will:**



* Lead a diverse team of software engineers, showing a genuine willingness to support and motivate them as they grow.
* Be a key connector between the Romanian team and sister companies within our global network, fostering collaboration and shared success.
* Working together with software Engineering managers from Sweden to win new business via Customer Engagement and Quotation writing.
* Set individual and project-related goals together with your team, focusing on helping each person thrive in their daily tasks.

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* MSc or BSc in Computer Science, Electronics, or equivalent experience in a related field.  

Interest and experience in leading teams, either as a line manager or technical project manager.
* A passion for working with embedded systems, cloud solutions, or Android system development, with hands-on experience in at least one of these areas.
* Confident communication skills in English, both verbal and written.
* A willingness to contribute to project planning, including effort estimation and software development reviews.
* Enthusiasm for collaborating with the Sales team to engage with customers and identify new business opportunities

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**


* An interest in integrating electronics with software, with previous experience being a plus.
* Familiarity with the consultancy business is advantageous, and a willingness to adapt to a dynamic, client-facing environment.
* An established network within the software development community, or an eagerness to build and expand industry connections.

### **WE OFFER**


* A welcoming and inclusive team culture, where everyone’s ideas and contributions are valued.
* Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development.
* A chance to be part of Sigma Connectivity, a global company with over 700 employees across 13 offices in 7 countries.


You’ll report directly to the CEO of Sigma Connectivity SRL, based at our headquarters in Lund, Sweden.



Ready to make an impact and help shape our future? We can’t wait to meet you!


### **MORE INFORMATION**



Henric Wainebro,  

Henric.Wainebro@sigmaconnectivity.se

Software Engineering Manager for global tech house in Iasi

Sigma Connectivity

2025-03-31

JR106560
Genesys empowers organizations of all sizes to improve loyalty and business outcomes by creating the best experiences for their customers and employees. Through Genesys Cloud, the AI-powered Experience Orchestration platform, organizations can accelerate growth by delivering empathetic, personalized experiences at scale to drive customer loyalty, workforce engagement, efficiency and operational improvements.
We employ more than 6,000 people across the globe who embrace empathy and cultivate collaboration to succeed. And, while we offer great benefits and perks like larger tech companies, our employees have the independence to make a larger impact on the company and take ownership of their work. Join the team and create the future of customer experience together.  

Job Title: Field Marketing Manager  

Department & Team: EMEA Marketing team  

Reports to: Regional Marketing Manager  

Location: Sweden  

Summary:
Reporting to the Regional Marketing Manager, Genesys is looking to hire a Field Marketing Manager for the Nordics and Baltic region based in Sweden. The position is created to support the regional marketing and Genesys sales teams with the planning and execution of marketing activities that will further drive sales as well as build the Genesys brand across enterprises, channel partners and ecosystem partners.  

Responsibilities include:* Reporting into the regional marketing leader to assist in the execution of field marketing activities for the region including:
	+ Lead-generation campaigns, run local webinars, Genesys events, trade shows, industry conferences and external speaking opportunities.
	+ Support budget management and program reporting
	+ Development of long term campaign plans and quarterly marketing plans with key channel partners.
	+ Management of OPEX and supporting the execution of marketing plans of key channel partners.
	+ Development and execution of end-user marketing activities.
	+ Work closely with the local Genesys Sales teams to drive joint success
	+ Utilise partner communications to increase brand awareness of Genesys.
	+ Work with cross functional groups in PR, Customer Advocacy and digital marketing on a project basis.

  

This person will regularly interface with the following people:* Regional Marketing Manager and EMEA marketing teams
* Regional sales teams, enterprise and channel sales management
* Strategic channel partners and SIs
* Global marketing programs managers.
* Regional Customer Success managers

  

Experience & Skills Required:* At least 4 years experience in an IT industry
* Fluent in Swedish and English, any other Nordic languages spoken are desirable but not essential
* Ideal candidate will have experience in Field and Channel Marketing, preferably in a B2B tier-2 channel model
* Experience in the full spectrum of the marketing mix
* Good personal communication and presentation skills are essential
* Experience working in CCAS or SaaS market would be desirable but not essential.
* Experience from working with campaign management tools like Salesforce CRM and Wordpress would be desirable but not essential.

  

Profile:
The candidate will be educated to degree level with strong commercial and presentation skills. They will be a self-starter, results oriented, highly motivated with a positive attitude and a good communicator with a proven track record in delivering successful marketing campaigns in an aggressive sales environment. The ability to prioritize activities in support of marketing and sales objectives is essential, the candidate must be able to strike the right balance between achieving EMEA marketing objectives and supporting local sales initiatives.  

Regular travel throughout the region will be a requirement of the role with a focus on The Nordics but could also include any other country in the Europe, Middle-East and Africa region, and to the US.

About Genesys:
Genesys empowers more than 8,000 organizations in over 100 countries to improve loyalty and business outcomes by creating the best experiences for their customers and employees. Through Genesys Cloud, the AI-powered Experience Orchestration platform, Genesys delivers the future of CX to organizations of all sizes so they can provide empathetic, personalized experience at scale. As the trusted platform that is born in the cloud, Genesys Cloud helps organizations accelerate growth by enabling them to differentiate with the right customer experience at the right time, while driving stronger workforce engagement, efficiency and operational improvements. Visit www.genesys.com.

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to equity in the workplace. title: Development Expert
description:
**About the role**


**LOCATION:** Sweden - Stenungsund, Austria - Linz, Finland - Porvoo
**HOURS:** Full-Time
**TYPE OF CONTRACT:** Permanent
**APPLICATION DEADLINE:** 22/01/2025  


Make Technical Excellence Real!  


The Digital Solutions department at Borealis is seeking a Development Expert to join our dynamic team. As a key player in our organization, you'll be at the forefront of driving technical excellence across our SAP landscape.  

  

These are the key responsibilities:  


* Technical Leadership & SAP Integration: Lead technical implementations across Ariba business areas, focusing on SAP integration and development, while providing solution architecture and guidance to implementation teams.
* Integration Solution Design: Design and implement robust integration solutions for both on-premise and cloud systems, including SuccessFactors, Ariba, Salesforce, and Mulesoft.
* Collaboration & Optimization: Collaborate with stakeholders to design, optimize, and automate system integrations, ensuring alignment with business requirements.
* Project Guidance: Guide project leads in planning, defining scope, and estimating processes to ensure successful project execution and delivery.
* Primary Technical Contact: Act as the primary technical contact for integration-related initiatives across Borealis business units, ensuring seamless communication and technical consistency.
**About you**

  

* Advanced certifications in SAP Integration Suite and SAP Extension Suite
* Proven experience with ABAP development, SAP Cloud Integration Platform (CPI) & SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)
* Minimum 7 years of hands-on technical implementation experience
* Strong background in solution architecture and system integration
* Demonstrated ability to manage complex stakeholder relationships and industry experience are required.
**Our offer**



Borealis has competitive compensation and benefits which you can read more about on our Career Page.
**Application Process**



If you're excited about the prospect of joining our team and being a part of Making It Real, please submit your application via the “apply now” button in the job posting to apply directly.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
**World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Coupled with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 55,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet.**

**Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of Capgemini, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 360,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2022 global revenues of €22 billion.**

**Mechanical Design Engineer**
------------------------------

**We are now working with interesting product development projects within the retail industry and need to grow our group of experts within Mechanical Design Engineering. If you would like to work with digital transformation in a fast-moving environment, where you are surrounded by a great team of engineers, this is a great opportunity!**  

  

**Your role**  

**Depending on your own background and experience, you will work on different projects that we are currently running at our client location. You will have daily contact with the client and be responsible for the execution of your assignment from concept to finished product, including product testing, certification and reliability testing. We also have an in-house team where we do full-scale project deliveries. You will be an important and central part of our cross-functional team and responsible for implementations and goals in our projects.**

**Requirements for the role:**
------------------------------

* **Minimum 3-5 years' of experience in product development as a Mechanical Design Engineer or other relevant background**
* **Experienced in SolidWorks or other CAD tools**
* **Experience within Consumer Products and PLM (PTC Windchill preferred)**
* **Understanding of Bill of Material and product packaging structure will be an advantage.**
* **You are challenged by technical complexity and can suggest technical solutions and designs that best meet the specified requirements**
* **Fluent in English**
* **Holding an EU work permit, being able to quickly relocate to Sweden**

**Your local office will be in Malmö, but you need to be able to travel to client location in Älmhult 2-3 times a week.**

  

**What we offer you**

**Capgemini Engineering is one of the world's leading consulting companies in R&D. We work in most industries globally. In Scandinavia, we focus mainly on Automotive, Industry, Telecom and Life Science. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-up companies. Today we are part of the Capgemini group, which gives us even more opportunities to find the right clients and projects. Based on the clients' needs, we provide expert competence, entire project groups, services and overall commitments. Always based on what best suits the client’s own organization and challenges.**

  

**Capgemini Engineering offers you a work environment that is characterized by innovation. As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you are part of something bigger. We care about you as a colleague and offer you a safe and favorable employment. For us, the community is important and in addition to professional development, we offer you a variety of activities. We work to promote participation by continuously arranging lunches, breakfasts, after works, sports events and more.**

**Join us and** **Get The Future You Want!**

**#LI-JM16**

**At Capgemini Engineering we value excellence, care, responsibility, dynamism and innovation. We offer a job with variation that leaves plenty of room for initiative and development. In fact, we are not just offering you a job, we’re inviting you to be part of our community where we will provide you trainings, tools & grounds for professional and personal growth. Each career experience is assorted by an attractive salary package.**

title: Transformation Manager for the Automotive sector
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**

**Business & Technology Solutions (BTS)** **is a growing practice in Sweden with the aspiration to be the key trusted advisor accompanying our clients on their transformation journey to a more successful, sustainable, and innovative future, bringing in-depth business and technology as well as transformation expertise. By joining BTS, you will have the opportunity to help shape the set-up, form the culture, and together decide on what is important to focus on initially and long term to create a dynamic, fun, and rewarding workplace.**  

  

**We are looking for Transformation Manager to join our Automotive team, where you work with some of the leading and most well-known brands within this industry driving their digitalization journey. As a Transformation Manager you play a leading role in complex client projects at the intersection of business and digital. Confident at working in a technology-driven environment (but not necessarily from a digital background or an expert in digital tools), you will bring proven skills and experience in leading and delivering consultancy projects or workstreams to** **design and implement new digital applications, platforms, and experiences** **. Business process and IT platform experience should be in one or more of the following –** **Supply Chain Management** **,** **Sourcing and Procurement** **,** **Sales & Distribution** **,** **Manufacturing processes** **,** **Connected Services** **and** **ecommerce** **. Please note that experience in vehicle product development is not in the scope for this role.**  

  

  

**A Transformation Manager is responsible for leading, advising and managing process changes using digital capabilities to improve operational efficiency, drive growth, and enhance overall business performance. This role requires a strong understanding of business processes, data analysis, and project management skills.**  

  

**Key responsibilities include:**  

* **Developing and executing large-scale business and digital transformation strategies to meet the organization's goals and objectives by collaborating with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliverables.**
* **Identifying areas for improvement and recommending changes to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of business operations.**
* **Build strong relationship and communicating effectively with stakeholders to keep them informed of transformation progress, risks, and issues and understand their needs and priorities.**
* **Staying up to date with industry trends and best practices to ensure the organization remains competitive.**
**What you'll bring:**  

* **Several years of experience in large-scale digital transformation or a related field in the automotive domain.**
* **Experience in advising management teams in navigating future direction of their business.**
* **Understanding of Systems Lifecycles and design.**
* **Process and platform experience in one or more of the following – Supply Chain Management, Sourcing and Procurement, Sales & Distribution, Manufacturing processes, Connected Services and ecommerce.**
* **Experience with SAP, Microsoft and Salesforce is a plus.**

  

**Soft skills and background:**  

* **You are characterized by your experience/interest in business development and sales, your focus on results, your strategic thinking, your high level of self-motivation and customer orientation.**
* **You are a strong communicator who understands the importance of fostering relationships with business and IT stakeholders, you are comfortable working in a mixed client and Capgemini agile environment – and have a good level of** **Swedish** **both spoken and written.**
* **You are fine with independent work but have experience of and thinks collaboration and teamwork is the ground for a good result.**
* **Bachelor's degree in business, management, or a related field.**

  

**Apply now! For more information about the team, role or others, please mail to bts\_se\_recruitment@capgemini.com****#LI-RR1**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Cloud Architect - Sectra Medical
description:
Do you excel in designing robust cloud architectures and implementing scalable solutions in Microsoft Azure? Do you enjoy problem-solving, designing, writing, presenting, and selling? Can you gather the most critical pieces of a complex puzzle and create a winning solution? Are you driven by seeing your solutions come to life through others? Take the opportunity to apply for the role of Cloud Architect at Sectra Scandinavia, with a focus on the Scandinavian market!
  
  

At Sectra, we deliver top-class medical software with cutting-edge technology. Right now, we’re about to revolutionize the medical software industry through our SaaS transformation. As a Cloud Architect, you'll play a pivotal role in driving this change and ensuring our software solutions continue to make a lasting impact on patient care in Scandinavia.
  
  

Sectra Medical is a long-term provider of IT systems for imaging management in healthcare. Our ambition is to lead the way in improving the efficiency of our customers’ diagnostics of medical images and contribute to better care outcomes for patients. In addition, we value our strong company culture, characterized by collaboration, respect, and drive. We are now looking for someone who wants to become a part of life at Sectra!
  
  

The Role
  
  

As a Cloud Architect at Sectra Scandinavia, you will join a team responsible for delivering cutting-edge technical solutions within the region. Your focus will be on designing cloud-based architectures, with a strong emphasis on Microsoft Azure technologies.
  
  

You will contribute to shaping Sectra's journey toward service delivery in Azure. You will work closely with both new and existing customers to design solutions that meet their needs. It is important to have a selling mindset and good verbal and presentations skills as this role requires the ability to balance customer needs, scalability, and cost-effectiveness while maintaining Sectra's high-quality standards.
  
  

**In this role, you will:**  

**Lead Cloud Transformation:** Be a key player in Sectra’s transition from on-premises solutions to cloud-based SaaS models, ensuring scalability, flexibility, and security.
  
**Drive Azure Cloud Design:** Create robust designs for Azure infrastructure, including ExpressRoute, virtual networks, and resource configurations.
  
**Support Public Procurements:** Develop tailored solutions during procurement processes that align with customer needs and expectations.
  
**Collaborate and Document:** Produce comprehensive documentation and share your designs both internally and externally, enabling seamless implementation and management.
  
**Promote Best Practices:** Standardize ways of working and contribute to solution design during project execution.
  
Work with great people
  
ERWIN KRIKKEN
  
Support Engineer & Project Engineer
  
"The atmosphere is always good, and my colleagues are the best. I enjoy working at Sectra and I hope that this will continue in the future."
  
JOHAN CARLEGRIM
  
General Manager
  
"For me, Sectra is a great place to work. While everyone at Sectra is highly skilled and professional, they are also easy-going and friendly."
  
DAVE KNIGHT
  
Project Manager
  
"The general atmosphere and support from colleagues are what I like the most about my work."
  
ZOE VARRICCHIO
  
Project Manager
  
"Regardless of how long you have been with our organization, your ideas are always taken into consideration, and provided that they are worthwhile, they tend to be implemented."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

Skills & Requirements The Cloud Architect is a central role with flexibility to shape the position based on your interests and expertise. You will collaborate closely with the Advanced Operations Scandinavia group and benefit from mentorship and support as you grow into the role.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

A Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.
  
Strong communication skills in both a Scandinavian language and English, spoken and written.
  
Experience in IT, with a focus on cloud technologies.
  
A solid understanding of Microsoft Azure, including virtual networks and ExpressRoutes.
  
Experience with designing and maintaining Azure cost management
  
Analytical skills with attention to detail.
  
Problem-solving abilities, both independently and collaboratively.
  
Clarity, honesty, and a winning mentality.
  
  

**Additional advantages:**  

Experience with integrations and technical documentation.
  
Knowledge of Azure security models, such as role-based access control (RBAC).
  
Experience in project management or service delivery.
  
Familiarity with network infrastructure and IT operations.
  
Proficiency in multiple Scandinavian languages.
  
  

As the role requires excellent language proficiency, we will only process applications written in a Scandinavian language.
  
  

We warmly welcome you to apply to Sectra, a workplace where our colleagues help create a great work environment that generates significant value for society!
  
  

**Start date:** Immediate or as agreed. Applications are reviewed, and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.
  
  

If this opportunity excites you, don’t hesitate to get in touch!
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Making a difference
  
  

Great colleagues
  
  

Personal development
  
  

Innovation & technology
  
  

Global environment
  
  

Working close to customers
  
  

About the company
  
  

Sectra develops and sells cutting-edge solutions for medical IT and cybersecurity. We help hospitals and those who are training future healthcare personnel to improve their efficiency so that patients can receive better care. We also support and help defense, authorities, and critical social functions to secure their communication against eavesdropping and protect their systems against unauthorized access. This is how we create conditions for a healthier and safer society.
  
  

One thing that identifies us at Sectra is our customer obsession— our ability and willingness to understand, create value for and stand up for our customers. This shared priority is at the core of our culture. Our customers describe this as having the knowledge to meet expectations, the passion to exceed them. As we hire for attitude and ability - train for skill, we happily expand your knowledge, if you bring the passion and willingness to learn.
  
  

Johan Sandberg | Contact Person

title: Enterprise Account Manager, Google Cloud
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of sales experience in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products and platforms.
* Experience engaging with accounts, selling a portfolio of products at C-level.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Experience with large, complex commercial and legal negotiations working with procurement, legal, and business teams.
* Experience promoting Google Cloud computing technologies to large and complex organizations across geographies.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across organizational boundaries, build relationships, and import and export talent and ideas to achieve a broader organizational goal.
* Ability to influence decisions at the executive level.
* Ability to present analyses and break down technical concepts into simple terms to present to diverse, technical, and non-technical audiences.
* Ability to communicate in Swedish fluently in order to manage relationships with international and local customers.


About the job
  
  

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Build executive relationships with enterprise customers. Bring to Google your relationships to help us grow into new organizations.
* Negotiate and manage complex business-cycles, often presenting to C-level executives in corporate customers.
* Lead account strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities, working collaboratively with Customer Engineers, and Google Partners.
* Understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans and business drivers, technology strategy and external landscape.
* Drive business development, forecast accurately, and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: Regional Vice President - Sweden
description:
nCino offers exciting career opportunities for individuals who want to join the worldwide leader in cloud banking.  


As nCino’s Regional Vice President (RVP) you will be responsible for net-new sales to financial institutions and for driving expansion within your territory’s existing customer base.  

Responsibilities* Identify and target prospective nCino customers within a geographic territory and market segment
* Challenge prospective customers to consider a new and innovative offering
* Drive opportunities through qualification and closure while maintaining a pipeline sufficient to achieve and exceed quarterly and annual sales goals
* Develop strong nCino brand presence within a geographic territory
* Use consultative approach to identify client needs and use detailed knowledge of the nCino solution and the Salesforce.com platform to fulfill those needs
* Manage complex sales cycle with new customers by mapping out decision-making and approval processes, compressing timelines, negotiating contracts and closing business
* Effectively identify prospective customer “mobilizers” and build consensus among key stakeholders
* Work effectively with inside sales partners and marketing to drive a consistent message in the marketplace
* Expand nCino presence within existing clients by maintaining relationship with key client stakeholders, partnering with nCino’s Customer Success team to drive adoption
* Sell newly released nCino products and offerings to existing customers


Qualifications*Required:** Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience
* 12+ years of experience or combination experience and education
* Strong professional background with consistent record of excellence
* Demonstrated ability to challenge executive decision makers, build consensus with client executives, and sell to the C-suite
* Strong listening skills and impeccable verbal and written communication ability; able to demonstrate software solutions onsite with client or via virtual meetings
* History of success in collaborative work environment; demonstrable ability to partner with nCino team members from product, sales, professional services, support, finance and others as required to accomplish sales goals and customer success
* Ability to travel to client and nCino office locations as required to accomplish and exceed goals

*Desired:** Banking domain expertise
* Commercial banking expertise
* Graduate degree and/or other certifications
* Flexible problem-solver who will thrive in nCino’s fast-paced, collaborative, entrepreneurial environment
* Organized, efficient, and able to maintain high level of production while also demonstrating process and administrative excellence


Travel Requirements* Requires up to 60% travel

 *If you thrive in a high-energy, entrepreneurial environment, we invite you to share your passion, ideas and excitement at nCino.* *The pay range for this role is based on relative market data and alignment with our compensation philosophy. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum of the pay range for each job posting, which is used to determine new hire rates/salaries and takes into consideration multiple factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills, abilities, proficiencies, experience, education,* *licensures/certifications,* *as well as business and organizational needs. nCino reserves the right to modify the posted range consistent with our internal practices and external market movement. The recruiter for this job posting can share more compensation details during the recruitment process, as base salary is only one component of the total compensation package per position posted.*
The base salary range for this job is:
£80,000.00 - £126,000.00
nCino provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability, genetics or other protected groups. In addition to federal law requirements, nCino complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
nCino is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, nCino will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us at recruiting@ncino.com.
Our commitment to inclusion and equality includes a strong belief that the diversity of our team is instrumental to our success. We strive to create workplaces where employees are empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

title: Revenue Cloud Solution Engineer - Nordics/Benelux
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Sales
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.


**Revenue Cloud Solution Engineer**

*-This role can be filled in any of the Nordic countries, or Benelux, depending where we find our nr 1 candidate-*

At **Salesforce Revenue Cloud** , we’re redefining how businesses manage revenue by simplifying complex processes across the entire revenue lifecycle. Our mission is to help companies accelerate growth with our next-generation **Quote-to-Cash** and **Revenue Lifecycle** solutions, all seamlessly built on the world’s #1 CRM platform.


Salesforce Revenue Cloud empowers businesses with a comprehensive suite of capabilities, including **CPQ** **,** **Billing** **,** **Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM)** **,** **Order Management** **,** **Subscription Management** **,** and **Asset Lifecycle Management** . These tools enable customers to optimize and automate every stage of the revenue process— from configuring quotes and managing contracts to orchestrating orders, handling recurring subscriptions, and tracking the lifecycle of assets.


With Salesforce Revenue Cloud, organizations can capture ROI faster, deliver seamless customer experiences, and unlock growth opportunities like never before. Our customers benefit from innovations such as **Agentforce** , AI-driven insights, and deep integration across the Salesforce Customer 360 platform.


As a **Revenue Cloud Solution Engineer** , you’ll be instrumental in driving customer success by showcasing the power of these solutions. You’ll partner with sales teams to design, demonstrate, and deliver compelling value propositions tailored to each customer’s unique challenges.


### **Your Impact**

You will be a trusted advisor to our customers, helping them address their unique challenges and achieve their goals with the Salesforce Revenue Cloud suite. Specifically, you will:


* **Discover** **:** Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand their pain points and identify opportunities to unlock value through **CPQ** **,** **Billing** **,** **CLM** **,** **Order Management** **,** **Subscription Management** **, and** **Agentforce** .
* **Design** **:** Craft innovative solutions that showcase how Revenue Cloud automates and simplifies revenue processes, including quoting, contracting, billing, order management, and customer support scenarios.
* **Deliver** **:** Lead compelling product demonstrations, workshops, and whiteboarding sessions that connect business needs to Salesforce solutions, highlighting innovations like **CLM** and AI-driven capabilities in **Agentforce** .
* **Enable** **:** Educate internal teams and external audiences on emerging trends, product developments, and industry best practices, ensuring successful adoption and implementation.
* **Digest** **:** Stay up-to-date on the latest product roadmaps, industry news, and trends to provide insightful recommendations to our customers.

### **Minimum Qualifications**

* A degree in Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience
* Knowledge of related applications, relational databases, web technologies, and APIs
* Understanding of accounting, billing, tax, revenue recognition, and subscription-based models
* Excellent written, verbal, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to work collaboratively in complex, cross-functional environments
* Pre-sales consulting experience, including RFP support, discovery sessions, solution design, and demonstrations
* Strong storytelling and public speaking abilities

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* Expertise with **Quote-to-Cash** and **Revenue Cloud** solutions
* Professional certifications (e.g., Salesforce CPQ, Billing, or Financial Management certifications)
* Experience as a solution/sales engineer for **CPQ** **,** **Billing** **,** **Contract Lifecycle Management** **,** **Subscription Management** **,** **Order Management** , or Financial Management systems
* Hands-on experience with Salesforce **CPQ** **,** **Billing** , Sales Cloud, or any Salesforce Industry Cloud
* Knowledge of subscription billing, revenue recognition, and SaaS pricing models
* Public speaking experience (events, webinars, or conferences)

### **Bonus Skills**

* Web development skills and familiarity with APIs (REST/SOAP)
* Experience with Salesforce **Commerce Cloud** or integration scenarios between Revenue Cloud and Commerce Cloud
* Membership in professional organisations such as **CPA/ACCA** or equivalent
* Data/AI experience

Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com .


Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce .
﻿

Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Quality Engineer
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
  

Responsibilities
  
We are now looking for a Quality Engineer to our SMS team in Malmö, Sweden. The team is responsible for a platform that delivers billions of transactions on a monthly basis with requirements of high resiliency, redundancy and speed.
  
As our new Test Engineer, you are joining forces with our successful SMS team, working with software quality engineering and test strategies for different testing phases. Teaming up with a newly formed team of test engineers, you are driving constant improvement of testing withing the product line, which means that you have a huge impact on the way our products are being tested!
  
In this role, you’ll be
  
* Supporting different teams with common approaches to enable them to become better at testing. Be it from helping them build automated test solutions or discussing methodologies around testing.
* Building a continuous integration pipeline, providing strategies around functional, non-functional, security and scalability testing to achieve high-quality standards.
* Develop, implement, and maintain comprehensive quality engineering processes and standards to ensure quality is built into the product from the start.
* Collaborate with development teams to integrate quality practices into every stage of the development lifecycle, from design to deployment.
* Conduct regular reviews and ensure adherence to quality engineering best practices.


**Requirements:**  

We are all about finding solutions to challenging problems. We believe that you are a curious person who loves to be updated with the latest test approaches, and you enjoy working with people from across multiple teams and locations. Your experience shows a consistent track record of working in complex technical environments. If you feel like you have the ability to influence and drive different initiatives and understand business priorities, we want you to join our team. Are you ready to push the limits and make a difference?
  
* Experience of building and maintaining some form of Test Automation Tool or pipeline
* Knowledgeable in programming as we will be building tools to enable our development teams to test efficiently
* Background in different test methodology like functional, regression, acceptance, exploratory or non-functional testing


Good to have
  
* Professional experience of working with continuous integration tools
* Experience in being a part of a test enablement or virtual test team in any form
* Software Development background


**Benefits:**  

Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
  
  

OUR HIRING PROCESS
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Sinch Messaging
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers – no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses – including many of the world’s largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
  
We dream big – for our company, our customers and our employees – and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries – probably somewhere near you!
  
  

About the role
  
If you're looking for a job that combines innovation, collaboration, and a friendly atmosphere, you've come to the right place! We are seeking a passionate and proven Sr. Product Marketing Manager to join our global product marketing team. Reporting to our Product Marketing Director of Messaging, you will own the product marketing strategy and positioning, and help the organization drive the GTM strategy for key audiences.
  
  

Join us and be a part of a team that values diversity, fosters creativity, and believes that great things happen when you work with talented and friendly colleagues.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

* Define and implement a cohesive product marketing strategy that positions Sinch's Messaging products as a leader in the space globally
* Partner with regional sales and marketing leadership and other cross-functional teams to drive product adoption and revenue growth (go-to-market planning, product strategy, marketing campaigns, sales enablement and more)
* Partner with product managers to influence the product roadmap, product competitiveness, and drive product adoption by sharing key market & customer insights
* Advocate for our customers and become an authority on our competition to ensure our products are accurately positioned in the market
* Measure, analyze and optimize product marketing programs to deliver better business outcomes
* Act as thought leader on customer experience and messaging
* Own the product marketing toolkit for your product including messaging, positioning, competitive intelligence, and personas
* Develop product content for external and internal audiences, such as web pages, blog posts, one-pagers, sales decks, demos, and feature functionality assets
* Launch new product features and identify ways to drive engagement for existing features
* Train and empower cross-functional teams to be product champions


**About you:**  

To be successful in the role you have solid experience of product marketing, having gained that experience in large international and complex organizations. You are a great collaborator and communicator who can bridge the gap between product, marketing and sales teams. You have strong analytical skills and ability to develop recommendations based on product, customer, and market data. Last but not least you are a critical thinker with excellent writing and presentation skills.
  
  

* Extensive experience in product marketing at technology companies, ideally from large, international and complex organizations
* Proven experience as a senior product marketing manager, launching a new product or working on complex product launches
* Experience communicating effectively and presenting to a diverse and senior range of stakeholders across different time zones
* Experience in customer communication tools or CPaaS is a plus
* Ability to travel if needed


Our Values
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple” and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
  
  

Bring your authentic self to Sinch
  
Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
  
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
  
  

Our Hiring Process
  
At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
  
Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
  
  

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/
