title: Technical Lead AI & ML
description:
Job description
  
We are seeking a brilliant Technical Lead to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate should have deep technical knowledge in machine learning and artificial intelligence, including a strong understanding of relevant programming languages, tools, and tech-stacks as well as a passion for coaching others. As a Tech Lead AI/ML, you will be responsible for designing and implementing cutting-edge AI/ML solutions to help our clients solve complex business problems.
  
  

You will work closely with our architects, development teams, project managers, and customers to ensure that our software solutions meet the highest standards of quality, scalability, and maintainability. You will lead, coordinate and coach other developers, while contributing hands-on technically to projects. You will also actively participate in the quotation process, together with Project office (PMO), sales and system engineers as applicable.
  
  

WHAT YOU WILL DO
  
  

Develop and implement advanced AI/ML algorithms, models, and systems to solve complex business problems.
  
Apply machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to IoT solutions and device edge-AI solutions, including working with embedded systems and sensors.
  
Use cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP to deploy and scale AI/ML solutions.
  
Assist sales and PMO with presales work with potential customers to understand their needs and recommend solutions.
  
Engage in dialogue with customers and other stakeholders to suggest technical solution(s) for customer’s ideas, vision and/or needs.
  
Answer technical questions from potential customers, direct and/or after investigation.
  
Understand the customer’s needs by asking open questions, being thoughtful, communicative, and creative.
  
Provide insights into technology through verbal pictures and sketched drawings.
  
Participate in the quotation process, together with PMO, sales and system engineers as applicable.
  
Work directly with our customers, document and present the solution and explain the technical decisions taken, including the tradeoffs and consequences of those decisions.
  
  

Contribute to the development of competence, best practices, tools, and frameworks to improve our AI/ML capabilities.
  
Collaborate with developers within and from other sites to ensure that our solutions are scalable and reliable.
  
Coach and guide developers to help them grow their technical skills and expertise.
  
Stay up-to-date with the latest AI/ML trends, tools, and technologies to ensure that our solutions are cutting-edge.
  
  

Basic qualifications
  
  

**To succeed in this role, we expect you to have:**  

10+ years of overall work experience.
  
5+ years of experience in developing ML algorithms and AI-driven solutions.
  
Experience and proven track record with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
  
Experience and proven track record with AI-driven IoT solutions in either consumer electronics, automotive, manufacturing, heavy equipment, mining or avionics.
  
Experience with edge-AI solutions, especially power, processing and memory optimization.
  
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
  
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  
Quick grasp of concepts and underlying patterns.
  
Ability to work in a collaborative, creative and team-oriented environment.
  
Ability to lead and positively influence others.
  
  

Preferred additional skills, personal traits, experience
  
Experience with ML on platforms such as Qualcomm, Nordics or Silabs.
  
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka to develop data pipelines for machine learning.
  
Visualizing and communicating data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders using data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
  
Experience developing web or mobile apps.
  
  

If you are a curious, adept, diligent, communicative, and collaborative leader with a passion for AI/ML and IoT solutions, we would love to hear from you.
  
  

We offer
  
Sigma Connectivity is a global leader in providing innovative technology solutions for businesses across industries. With over 19 years of experience in the industry, we specialize in developing custom software and hardware solutions, especially connected products within consumer electronics and IoT devices that help our clients optimize their operations and achieve their strategic business goals. Our solutions are scalable, reliable, cost-efficient and secure. We work closely with our clients to understand their vision and ensure that our solutions meet their specific needs and requirements.
  
  

At Sigma Connectivity, we believe in the power of technology to transform businesses and drive innovation. We are committed to delivering exceptional results for our clients, and we take pride in our ability to build long-lasting relationships based on trust, transparency, and mutual success.
  
  

Our team of 700 brilliant engineers are passionate about technology and are dedicated to designing and building cutting-edge solutions that leverage the latest advancements in technologies across industries. We foster a culture of sharing experiences and knowledge, with a touch of the Nordic work ethic. Our main office is in Lund, Southern Sweden. We ensure global presence with offices in US, UK, Poland, Germany and Denmark. We are a fast-growing company and are constantly looking for open-minded, talented people who want to be part of our journey. Within Sigma, you will never work alone.

title: Lead Architect Mobility
description:
Are you passionate about designing solutions and lead architects that enable business growth in a dynamic, agile environment? If so, join our Mobility tribe, where we develop and maintain cutting-edge solutions for branded motor insurance partnerships. From branded web shops and mobile apps to API products and core insurance systems, we cover the entire customer journey and ensure the stability and scalability of our platforms.
  
About the role
  
As Lead Architect, you will take a central role in guiding and shaping the architectural direction within the Mobility Tribe. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders across the business, including partners, product owners, and development teams, to ensure the delivery of robust and scalable solutions. Your role will involve translating business strategies into actionable architectural plans, balancing the need for innovation with the practicalities of legacy systems, and aligning priorities with development squads.
  
You will also play a crucial role in knowledge sharing within a senior team of architects and contribute to setting and maintaining architectural standards across the organization. This is an opportunity to influence the direction of key systems while working in the intersection of business and technology.
  
We offer
  
At If, we believe in empowering our employees while providing a supportive and inclusive environment. Here are some of the benefits you can expect:
  
An inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued.
  
Opportunities for career development in the Nordic region's leading insurance company.
  
Hybrid working options to promote work-life balance.
  
Health-promoting initiatives, including wellness allowances and sports activities.
  
Comprehensive insurance benefits and competitive pension savings.
  
A collaborative and innovative professional environment.
  
Lunch benefit
  
High pension savings
  
  

About the team
  
The Mobility tribe plays a vital role in our organization, developing solutions that support branded partnerships and the broader customer journey. Our work spans from building user-friendly digital interfaces to maintaining the core systems of record for customer, policy, claims, and invoicing. The tribe is made up of cross-functional, autonomous teams that work together to ensure our platforms are scalable, secure, and high-performing.
  
This role is part of the Mobility Architecture unit within our broader IT Architecture organization. Together, we ensure that architectural decisions are deeply aligned with both business needs and technical feasibility, fostering innovation and quality throughout the company.
  
Who are you?
  
You are a seasoned architect with a collaborative mindset, a passion for modern technology, and the ability to navigate complex enterprise environments. You excel at aligning architectural solutions with business goals and thrive in a role that bridges business strategy and IT development.
  
  

**Your background includes:**  

Experience from development of distributed systems in a complex enterprise setting where you give architectural support to multiple teams working agile
  
Proficiency in API design and integration for third-party and partner applications.
  
A strong development background in languages like C# or Java, and familiarity with public cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
  
The ability to communicate effectively in both Swedish and English.
  
  

If you’re someone who enjoys exploring new technologies, values collaboration, and has the ability to turn strategic visions into practical solutions, we’d love to hear from you
  
Additional facts and the recruitment process
  
**Application deadline:** Please send in your application by January 27, 2025 the latest. Please note that screening and interviewing will start before the end of the application deadline.
  
**To apply for the position:** Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the application form.
  
**Work location:** Stockholm or Göteborg.
  
**Travelling:** Traveling within the Nordic countries is required.
  
**Start:** As soon as possible/by agreement.
  
For more information, please contact Patrik Kostic, Head of Mobility Architecture patrik.kostic@if.se

title: Engineering Manager Data Platform
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our vision is to make cities more livable! EasyPark Group is a global company and a true leader in its domain. There is a clear ambition to quickly grow in coverage and offer our services to more customers and partners.


This is an exciting opportunity to become part of the EasyPark team as Engineering Manager for the data platform team. In this role you’ll oversee the team’s people, processes, delivery and drive the data platform evolution and collaborate with customer teams and stakeholders.

**The role**


As the Engineering Manager for our data platform team, you will lead a distributed team of data engineers dedicated to building and scaling our global data platform. We believe in lean and agile principles, where team members feel and exercise ownership and responsibility to navigate toward goals and achieve their mission.


Your role will include: refining the team’s delivery processes and operational maturity, engaging with internal customers and stakeholders across the company to build, prioritize and communicate the team’s roadmap. Your experience in crafting technical platforms in other organizations will bring valuable insights, while your open-mindedness will help shape our approach to data overall.

**You will contribute & make an impact through the following:**

* Lead and grow a distributed high-performing team by providing mentorship, coaching, and technical guidance while fostering a culture of collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
* Contributing to and promoting a healthy and agile software development culture with sustainable delivery
* Together with the team, shape the vision for the data platform’s future, aligned with business priorities and technical goals. You inspire the team to innovate and successfully bring that vision to life. You communicate and evangelize that vision and the roadmap to achieve it
* Taking on responsibility for the team’s delivery, and the technical health of the data platform as well as its architectural evolution

**About You**

* You bring experience as a leader of an agile development team with great talent, ideally in the infrastructure and platform development areas
* You have a passion for continuous learning and improvement
* You are a great communicator, with excellent interpersonal and leadership skills
* You enjoy leading change in a fast-growing and scaling company
* You have interest in / expertise in modern cloud-based data warehouses and data modeling and governance practices


This role is based at the EasyPark headquarters in Stockholm/ Sweden, and we expect you to be in the office at least a couple of days a week. Fluency in English is required for this position (Swedish is not needed).

**Life at EasyPark**


We are a values-driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiative and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embrace change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.

**Some of the perks of joining the EasyPark team**

* **Flexible ways of working:** combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* **Digital global onboarding**: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* **Office environment:** an open and colorful office environment in the city center + free coffee, fruit and of course… a ping pong table.
* **Proactive health support:** your well-being is important to us, why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* **Virtual coffee chats**: join the internal Slack channel & randomly connect with a new EasyParker across the globe each week: take a break, have a chat & spark that cross-collaboration
* **Work for an award-winning company:** for three years in a row (2019, -20, -21) EasyPark was awarded Sweden’s Best Managed Companies by Deloitte.
* **Pension, insurances & health reimbursement:** Of course we have the basics in place, and encourage everyone an active & healthy lifestyle, by putting your reimbursement to use for physical activities.

title: Business consultant – Social Care - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide citizens and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and Social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors within health and welfare. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
About the role
Do you want to work with a market leader, modern product portfolio for the next generation of offering to our welfare industry? Do you have deep domain knowledge about the municipality’s welfare and social care? Do you have experience of working as a social worker, system administrator in a municipality or have been working in Lifecare or a similar system?
As part of our growth strategy, we are seeking a Business consultant that help us to continue to implement Lifecare for the Swedish municipal social care market. Our team consists of professionals within Project Management and Consulting that working towards and together with our customers to implement Lifecare, that gives the municipality simplified work processes, high support in the daily work and increases the possibilities of putting the caretaker at the center through well-developed citizen services.
In Tietoevry we believe in openness, independent thinking, and providing our employees with opportunities to grow.
In this role you will
In this role you will be responsible for implementing Lifecare for our customers. You will have a close dialogue with them, to plan the implementation and how to get the best value from the system by suggesting how to streamline their work and set up their processes.
This involves both travel within Sweden for on-site training, as well as being able to hold trainings and meetings digitally and remotely. As a dedicated Consultant you will have great opportunities to contribute to the development of our system Lifecare for the entire municipal Individual- and Family Services sector. You will* Arrange and lead meetings with customers
* Plan and implement trainings for our customers in Lifecare Individ- och Familjeomsorg
* Create content and provide webinars
* Bring in ideas based of the customer needs to support further development of Lifecare
* Advise customer on working methods and how to get the optimal value of using our solutions
* Create training materials
* Keep up to date with laws and regulations in the field


We are looking for someone that* Has a Degree of Bachelor of Science in Social Work
* Has a genuine interest and experience in individual- and family care services within municipal social care
* Broad experience and deep domain knowledge primarily of the Swedish welfare and social care landscape, experience using Lifecare IFO or other equal systems for individual and family services
* Good knowledge of current legislation around the social care act
* Has strong pedagogical skills
* Can express yourself clearly in Swedish, both spoken and written


As a person you are an engaged and open team player who loves providing excellent service to our customers and drive things forward. You are attentive and always eager to learn more and enjoy sharing and increasing your knowledge while working with others collaboratively. You are motivated by planning your working days yourself and the mix of both working together with colleagues and customers as well as independently.
What’s in it for you?
With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work in the area of social care. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ once a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
Could you be our new colleague?
We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager anna.kristiansson@tietoevry.com *We perform background checks on all final candidates.**Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
#LI-Hybrid
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Senior Sales Engineer will work with the Direct Sales and Alliance teams to provide technical support during the sales cycle for our relevant solutions within Sovos’ Indirect Tax Technology Suite (ITTS). The Senior Sales Engineer acts as the bridge between sales and product, professional services & support, utilizing technical expertise to support the sales team and deliver solutions that meet customer needs.



The Senior Sales Engineer will be adept at leveraging technical expertise to deliver innovative solutions, ensuring a seamless integration of product offerings with client needs. Also, this role possesses strong communication, enabling effective cross-functional collaboration and the successful execution of complex sales initiatives. Known for developing robust sales strategies, conducting impactful product demonstrations, and providing comprehensive technical support to both clients and internal sales teams. The Senior Sales Engineer will report to the Sales Engineering Manager – Europe.


*More specifically you will:*


* Provide superior domain expertise around ITTS solutions
* Maintain expert level understanding of functionality and technical architecture of our products
* Assist in the client discovery process to help uncover unforeseen challenges and desired solution architecture. Also conduct reviews of discovery questionnaires to ensure customer landscape knowledge is documented and any other sales opportunities are identified
* Develop a firm understanding of customer needs, pain points, and requirements around the ITTS and align Sovos solutions to fulfill the needs and requirements to eliminate the pain
* Work closely with Sovos’ Sales to conduct sales and solutions presentations
* Collaborate with Professional Services and product functions to ensure a successful onboarding post sale
* Maintain and continually improve demonstration capabilities in order to be able to present to customers a compelling and coherent narrative as to the key features and benefits of Sovos solutions
* Conduct in-depth technical presentations and product demonstrations to prospects and clients.
* Act with integrity and demonstrate ethical behavior in all matters with all stakeholders
* Take full responsibility for ensuring internal and external customer satisfaction
* Demonstrate a high degree of self-awareness and commitment to personal development and learning
* Focus on process improvement, adept at optimizing sales workflows and driving efficiency to enhance revenue growth and customer satisfaction.
* Develop and lead training sessions both within and outside the Sales Engineer department
* Serve as a subject matter expert surrounding the creation of RFP and RFI responses for prospective new clients
  

**What We Need From You:**


* Bachelor’s in related field, or equivalent combination of experience and education
* Minimum 6 years of Sales Engineer experience or equivalent
* Ability to be strategic towards business outcomes as well as manage and handle day-to-day details and deadlines
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast paced environment
* Ability to manage multiple projects at once and prioritize activities
* Thorough knowledge of MS Office software including Excel, Word, & Power Point
* Well-developed business ethics and the ability to maintain a high level of discretion
* Self-motivated and strong drive to succeed
* Solid knowledge on different communication protocols (e.g. APIs, SFTP, AS2 etc. as well as different delivery formats (e.g. IDOC, EDIFACT, XML, UBL etc).
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Multiple language skills preferred
* Moderate travel required for client meetings, trade shows, Sovos Events, and special projects
* Essential Job Functions:
	+ Interact effectively with teammates, colleagues and customers
	+ Comprehend and communicate complex concepts
	+ Concentrate, analyse and resolve complex problems
	+ Utilise technology (e.g. phone systems, computer hardware and software applications) to fulfil work requirements

**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*

  

**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
We are Happy Socks, an innovative fashion company that specializes in designing and producing unique, high-quality fashion items. We sell directly to consumers through our online and physical channels, as well as wholesale to a range of partners. Our tech team is at the core of our digital innovation and development, driving initiatives that enhance the customer experience, optimize internal processes, and improve the efficiency of our supply chain. We value creativity, collaboration, and a forward-thinking approach to problem-solving.

**Role Overview**:

  

As a Platform Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that supports our applications and services. You will collaborate closely with developers, product teams, and other stakeholders to create scalable, reliable, and secure systems that power our platform. Your work will ensure our tech stack is efficient, resilient, and optimized for our business needs.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* **Design and Develop:** Build and maintain platform infrastructure to support scalability, reliability, and performance across our applications.
* **Automation:** Develop tools and scripts to automate deployment, monitoring, and other operational tasks.
* **Monitoring and Performance:** Set up comprehensive monitoring systems and ensure optimal performance of platform components.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with software developers and other engineers to align infrastructure with application requirements.
* **Security:** Implement and maintain security best practices across infrastructure components, as well as in our development life cycle (SDLC).
* **Incident Response:** Participate in on-call rotation and assist in troubleshooting and resolving incidents to minimize downtime.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Identify and drive opportunities to improve platform architecture and processes.
* **Disaster Recovery Planning:** Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans to ensure business continuity.
* **Business Continuity Planning (BCP):** Collaborate with stakeholders to create and update business continuity plans.

**Requirements**:

* Knowledge of microservices architecture.
* Strong experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Proficiency in infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Solid understanding of networking, security, and system administration.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
* Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash).
* Problem-solving attitude and ability to work in a collaborative environment.

**Nice to Have**:

* Experience with Business Central.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana).
* Exposure to distributed systems and event-driven architecture.
* Previous experience working in a fashion or retail tech environment.


But most importantly, you have the personality to fit a somewhat crazy, fun work environment where we believe in color and playfulness, a place where you can expect the unexpected and you are a source of creative weirdness.

 **Why Join Us?**


Are you someone who thrives in collaborative environments, where teamwork is key and innovation is encouraged? Do you want to be part of a smaller development team and work close to the business? Here you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our site is up to date and ensuring a seamless user experience. - **If this sounds like you, get in touch!**


So if you're ready to join a diverse and inclusive team where your personality and skills are valued, we want to hear from you! Apply now and let's get you on board ASAP.

*At Happy Socks, we're all about diversity, so people of all genders, ages, and backgrounds are encouraged to apply.*

 **Last note**


We are happy to receive your application straight away - but we want to make you aware that we will have a slight delay to our processing due to holidays. So please stay tuned! Thanks!

title: Onsite IT Support Engineer
description:
**About:** 




  





 We are seeking a talented and motivated IT Technology Support On-Site Engineer to join our clients dynamic team in Stockholm.
 



  





 Our client is a leading global financial technology company headquartered in Ireland. They are at the forefront of banking and trading infrastructure, serving clients globally with offices in New York, Chicago, Toronto, London, Cambridge, Paris, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Singapore, Auckland and now Stockholm. Their services are woven into the hottest trends in global tech, including high-performance Networking, Cloud, Security, and AI (Artificial Intelligence).
 



  





**The Role:** 




  





 As a Technology Support On-Site Engineer, you will play a critical role in supporting their trading operations and technology infrastructure. You will work closely with the client’s technology team, and other technology professionals to ensure the smooth operation of their options trading platform. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and contribute to the success of a global alternative investment firm.
 



  





**Typical Job duties would include:** 









 •On-Site Technical Support: Serve as the primary technical point of contact for the client, providing on-site support for all options trading technology systems.
 



 •System Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor the health and performance of internal systems, ensuring that they are operating optimally. Conduct regular maintenance activities, including software updates and configuration changes, to keep systems up to date.
 



 •Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Diagnose and resolve technical issues. Escalate complex problems to appropriate internal teams and coordinate with them to find timely solutions.
 



 •Incident Management: Respond to incidents and service requests raised by the client, adhering to defined service level agreements (SLAs) and following established incident management processes. Document incidents and their resolutions accurately.
 



 •Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with key client stakeholders, understanding their requirements and proactively addressing their concerns. Serve as a technical advisor to the client.
 



 •System Enhancements and Upgrades: Collaborate with the Technology development team to implement system enhancements and upgrades. Participate in testing and validation activities to ensure smooth deployment.
 



 •Training and Knowledge Sharing: Conduct training sessions for the client's technical staff to enhance their understanding of the options trading systems. Share technical knowledge and best practices with both internal teams and the client to foster continuous improvement.
 








**We’re looking for someone who has technical proficiency in:** 









 •Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
 



 •It is desirable to have specifically strong knowledge of 365, Azure, Endpoint Management, Device Deployment. AV troubleshooting.
 



 •Experience: Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in a similar role within the financial services industry, providing on-site technical support and troubleshooting.
 



 •Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyse complex technical issues, identify root causes, and propose effective solutions. Strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills with the ability to handle high-pressure situations calmly.
 



 •Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey technical information clearly and concisely. Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships with clients and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
 



 •Client Focus: Demonstrated ability to understand and fulfil client requirements while providing exceptional customer service. Proactive in anticipating client needs and exceeding their expectations.
 



 •Adaptability and Flexibility: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Willingness to adapt to changing priorities and take on additional responsibilities as required.

title: Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 3+ years of relevant experience
* General knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers


**Nice to Have:**
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**
* Remote work option
* Employment contract
* Stable employment with an attractive salary
* Unlimited paid holidays
* Various benefits including private medical care, Multisport, and pre-paid cards
* Opportunity to work in an international department and collaborate with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds
* Participation in the development of a leading international software firm
* Freedom and autonomy to succeed, with an unlimited vacation policy that focuses on results


 At Unit4, you will join a team of enthusiastic professionals dedicated to personal and professional growth. If you are excited about working in a challenging international environment and making a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.



  





**We at the Infrastructure team,** 
 work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.
 



  





**As a Data Engineer** 
 , you will play an important role in the Data Platform team which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.
 



  





**What do we expect from you:** 



* 3+ years of experience in data engineering
* Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
* Experience working with a large data set
* Experience building complex ETL pipelines
* Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
* Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python
* Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git
* Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them



  





**What will you work on:** 



* Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
* Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
* Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
* Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
* Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
* Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
* Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
* Setup best practices and processes around software and data development



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Working with messaging systems like Kafka
* Knowledge in Kubernetes
* Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
* Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift



  





 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
 



  





 Sounds like your dream job?
 



  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



 We only accept applications in English.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Start Date:** 
 Q1 2024
 



**Reporting to:** 
 Interim Chief Product Officer (and CEO)
 



**Personnel Responsibility:** 



* Initially outsourced R&D team oversight.
* Potential for future team growth.



  
 



**Company Overview** 




 PriceAgent is a leading company in the Price optimization and analytics industry, driving innovation and delivering cutting-edge solutions for several global industries servicing data and insights for price optimization. Our mission is to empower businesses across the world with actionable insights through state-of-the-art technology.
 



  
 



**Role Overview** 




 As the Product Manager for PriceAgent, you will be responsible for owning and delivering on the companies product roadmap and ensuring it meets customer needs and ambitious business objectives. Acting as the key link between the development team, executive leadership, and customers, you will guide the product's strategic direction and operational execution.
 



  
 



**Key Responsibilities** 




**Strategic Product Management** 



* Define and communicate the product vision aligned with business goals in partnership with Chief Product Officer
* Develop, maintain, and execute the product roadmap, ensuring alignment with client needs and market opportunities.
* Prioritize and manage the product backlog, ensuring clarity in requirements and objectives for the development team.



  





**Product Development** 



* Lead the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from initiation to successful launch.
* Set up and manage tasks in tools like ClickUp and create clear visual workflows in Figma (or similar tools).
* Collaborate with the R&D team to maintain development schedules, budgets, and quality.
* Evaluate product releases against defined goals and metrics, identifying and mitigating risks as needed.



  





**Sales Enablement and Promotion** 



* Collaborate with sales and marketing to develop sales tools, product positioning, and messaging.
* Educate the sales team on product value propositions and provide ongoing support throughout the sales process.
* Assist in planning and executing product launches, ensuring alignment with sales and marketing strategies.



  





**Market Intelligence** 



* Develop a deep understanding of customer needs in key markets, including US and Europe, buyer behavior, and competitive landscapes.
* Analyze market trends to identify opportunities for product differentiation and innovation.



**Stakeholder Collaboration** 



* Build consensus across teams and influence decisions at all organizational levels.
* Support internal teams and external clients with product-related queries and training.



  
 



**Required Skills & Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, marketing, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of experience in product management roles for online or SaaS services.
* Proven track record of managing product development teams and delivering high-quality software solutions.
* Experience in a SaaS, or similar environment is highly preferred.
* Strong analytical and communication skills, with the ability to balance technical and business perspectives.
* Proficiency in agile development methodologies and tools like ClickUp, Figma, React.js, Node.js, AWS solutions, and understand why we use NoSQL databases and cloud native infrastructures
* Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Fluent in English and Swedish, with excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.



  
 



**Travel Requirements** 



* Occasional travel for face-to-face meetings with prospective clients and on-site training sessions within the region.



  
 



 Join PriceAgent to lead the evolution of innovative solutions and drive impactful results in the price optimization space. If you’re a proactive, adaptable, and visionary product manager, we’d love to hear from you!
